Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: In this superfragrant and forward wine, wonderful rose-petal and lychee-fruit aromas are well-matched by rich, floral and fruity flavors like Anjou pear and pink grapefruit. It is dry, rather full bodied, very smooth and mouthfilling in texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fulcrum 2019 Dry Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The sultry, dense nose offers aromas of rose, white peach, lychee and white pepper, making for a classic Gewürztraminer profile. It's rounded and silken in feel on the palate, yet well-balanced and lifted by flecks of spice and tangerine acidity. A potpourri note extends on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2019 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hallmark aromas of lychee, ginger and jasmine make for a classic Gewürz profile on the nose. It's rounded and ripe on the palate yet honed by a pleasantly pithy texture. Juicy lychee and peach flavors are studded with rose and dried floral spice, making this a balanced yet fully fleshed out offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Spring 2019 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Blossomy aromas of jasmine and tuberose meld with melon and spice in this boisterous wine. There's good texture and grip to the rounded palate, with pithy pomelo and grapefruit flavors fleshed out by melon and blossom accents. It ends with a zippy zing of citrus.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hickory Hollow 2018 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Boisterous aromas of canned peach, jasmine and potpourri echo on the rounded, sultry palate. A core of lychee and peach is studded with plenty of ginger spice, with orangy acidity lifting it all up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Weis 2019 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The aromas leap up with notes of lychee, pink grapefruit and ginger. The palate is richly flavored, showing nuance and detail. Cloudy with a light gold tinge, it drinks bone-dry, thoroughly delightful, with spot-on balance. The cleansing finish kicks it up a notch.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2019 Orange Oak Ridge Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Luscious and floral, this full-bodied and slightly sweet wine is beautifully aromatic, offering rose-petal and lychee scents that lead to ripe Anjou pear flavors. Fermented and aged in oval oak vats for eight months, it develops a mouthcoating texture followed by a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2019 Deep End Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Red Mountain is best known for its power-packed reds. This orange wine comes from 1978 plantings. The aromas jump out of the glass, with notes of lychee, ginger, flower and wet rock. Full-bodied, perfumed flavors follow. It carries, with bitters on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Liberty Lake 2019 Gewürztraminer (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This high-quality, refreshing, dry wine balances exuberant peach and lychee flavors with vivid acidity and medium body for an appetizing, palate-cleansing effect.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2019 Dry Estate Bottled Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of lychee, rose petal and ginger leap up from the glass. Smooth, almost thick feeling off-dry flavors follow. It wants a bit more acidity to offset the sugar, but there are still a lot of good things happening.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pacific Rim 2018 Ramos Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from some of the oldest vines in the Columbia Gorge, planted in 1968. Generous aromas of Mandarin orange, flower, lychee and ginger lead to just off-dry drinking, exquisitely balanced fruit flavors that are light on their feet but bring intensity. It's gorgeous, exhibiting the area's acidity and mineral streaks.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: History 2016 Mont Elise Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Classic notes of lychee, white tea and honeysuckle extend from nose to finish in this gorgeously perfumed, fruity white. Just a lip-smacking shade off dry, it's a juicy, exuberantly fresh sip that's perfect as an aperitif or accompaniment to delicate spiced foods. It's a fantastic bang-for-your-buck find that's best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2019 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Boom! The aromas explode with notes of lychee, ginger and white flowers, bringing vitality. The palate drinks dry and is light on its feet but with plenty of flavor, with mouthwatering acidity that brings it home.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Le Doubblé Troubblé 2019 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Heady plumes of jasmine blossom and musk perfume this sprightly semisweet Gewürztraminer. Light-bodied but concentrated in lychee and white peach flavors, it's a juicy, easy-drinking sip rimmed by a murmur of tea tannins on the finish. At peak now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fitz-Ritter 2019 Dürkheimer Abtsfronhof Spätlese Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are reserved for the variety, with notes of lychee and flower. Light floral flavors follow, with the concentration not always seeming there.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Rocky Pond 2019 Clos CheValle Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Lake Chelan)

Description: Notes of pink grapefruit and lemon candy mark this light-bodied, delicately sweet white. Moderate in concentration, it's an easy-drinking, fruity sip that's best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Sun Garden 2018 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Colorful aromas of jasmine, peach and lychee fruit meet rich fruit and floral flavors on a full body in this classic-styled wine. Very good depth and unabashed exuberance make it special to sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Castello di Amorosa 2018 Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Description: Sourced from the Hyland Vineyard, this bone-dry and intensely fragrant take on the grape is exceptional in every way. Scents of clover, mint and body powder lead into a varietally true wine with nothing cloying about the deep, rich flavors of Meyer lemon, peach and papaya. It's full bodied, flavorful and complex.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Hyland 2019 Old Vine Single Vineyard Gewürztraminer (McMinnville)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied guava, grapefruit cream and precise tropical notes show on the nose of this bottling. It's bone dry and sizzling with acidity on the tightly woven palate, where orange blossom flavors are crisp and bright.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2019 Gewürztraminer (Central Coast)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Part of the winery's value-priced tier, this wine is sourced from a single-estate vineyard. It de-emphasizes (without abandoning) the floral, talcum powder character of the grape, putting its focus on a pretty mix of peach, mango and banana fruit. There's a touch of coconut also, bringing unusual complexity to such an affordable, fruit-powered example.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Eola Hills 2019 Gewürztraminer (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of orange blossom, plumeria, tuberose, jasmine and fruit-cocktail aromas leap off the nose of this medium-sweet bottling. The wine is zippy and nearly pétillant on the palate, where flavors of tropical white flower and orange syrup are ripe while zesty.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fetzer 2019 Shaly Loam Gewürztraminer (Monterey County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The apple and orange flavors are rounded out with some residual sweetness, which tends to open up the fruitiness while muting the distinctive flower and talc aromatics typical of the grape. This is a fruity, forward wine sliding close to an off-dry impression.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Gewürztraminer (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Wonderful litchi aromas and rose-petal flavors give this smooth and richly textured wine a compelling expression of a famously floral grape variety. With just a touch of residual sugar, the wine's full body and mouthfilling effect help the flavors linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Husch 2019 Estate Bottled Dry Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Description: Subtle notes of crushed stone and smoke lend elegance to Gewürztraminer's more ebullient lychee and white peach flavors here. Just a shade off-dry, it's a spicy, juicy wine with a fresh, clean finish. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2018 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Description: Intensely perfumed notes of honey and peach preserves extend from nose to palate here. Medium-sweet and luscious in style, it's a juicy, fruity sip with a slightly tropical dried mango finish. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Windisch 2017 Herrnsheimer Schloss Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)

Description: Pert pink grapefruit and lychee flavors are edged by sweetness and a hint of tannin in this off-dry Gewürztraminer. It's light-bodied and freshly balanced. The finish is marked by a touch of burnt caramel. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: St. Christopher 2018 Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)

Description: Earth, beeswax, honey and candied lemon peel unite on this wine's heady, intense nose. More air brings notions of barley sugar that also characterize the rich, sweet palate of this late-harvest style wine. The concentration of flavors is immense. Candied-peel freshness with piercingly sweet acidity cuts like diamond and makes this compelling and rich. Lovely now, the wine is so concentrated that time has nothing on it. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Vendanges Tardives Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Exquisite ripeness and freshness are expressed on this wine's intriguing nose, showing juicy, ripe, yellow peach which melds with boxwood and passion fruit. The palate comes in with sweetness, pushing the passion-fruit notions and redoubling on that juicy peach. Freshness comes from the ripe and fully fragrant zestiness of orange and tangerine. It's a highly aromatic, medium-sweet wine. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2018 Furstentum Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Mandarin peel and pith, juicy peach and Damask rose petal all unite on this wine's richly aromatic nose. The palate adds the juicy sweetness of Mirabelle compote as well as a wonderfully countering note of bitterness. Something heightened and pristine about that bittersweet core seems to radiate freshness and energy. The wine is medium sweet and concentrated.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2017 Vieilles Vignes Furstentum Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe Mirabelle, candied tangerine and barley-sugar notes dance on the intense nose of this wine. On the palate these flavors burst with tempered sweetness, reveling in the intense pithiness of tangerine zest. This wine is concentrated, elixir-like and sweet, yet racy with citrus and appetizing with its intense juiciness. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The rosewater notes of Turkish delight meet the pithy bitterness of orange zest on the expressive nose of this wine. The palate plays with the sweet and bitter interaction of fleshy, ripe peach and orange zest, taking its aromatic game to the very edge. This wine is juicy, floral, tropical concentrated. The finish is more than medium sweet but absolutely zesty. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2018 Brand Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A flinty hint of reduction blends into the rose petal and peach notes of this wine's aromatic nose. Concentrated, pithy zestiness takes over on the palate, providing as much texture as freshness. Much power and energy are chaneled into this wine, yet it comes across as balanced, pitting all this pith against its gentle sweetness and a sheer, endless orange-zest finish. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2018 Schlossberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The headiness of candied mandarin and tangerine peel abounds on this wine's nose while crushed mint add an ethereal note. The palate comes in with immense concentration and sweetness. This is countered by a lovely candied-citrus-peel bitterness that heightens the experience. Creaminess, gentle spice and blossom honey trail in its wake. It's intense and very sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2018 Vendanges Tardives Brand Crand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Peach, earth, smoke and rose petal come together on the nose of this aromatic wine. Slight smokiness also tempers exuberant rose notes while boosting the rounded, juicy ripeness of peach. This concentrated wine comes with a pithy, pleasantly bitter and mouthwatering texture that enlivens the medium-sweet finish. It is energetic and concentrated. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2018 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The earthiness of russet-pear peel surrounds baked peach notes on this wine's nose. On the palate the pear peel turns into a fine, slightly but pleasantly bitter texture that sits well with the almost luscious sweetness of the fruit. The concentration is immense, helped along by the viscous smoothness of the ripe peachiness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2017 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Reduction still clouds the nose of this wine, but in a promising, smoky fashion. The palate shows the vivid ripeness of juicy peach, the slightly bitter, almond-edged pithiness of cooked peach skin and the sweetness of peach compote. Eveything is intense and pithiness makes the mouth water. Drink this rich, mellow but exciting wine by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2018 Steingrubler Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of baked peach on the nose of this wine have a pleasantly bitter edge of honeycomb. Juicy, ripe peach fruit becomes even more intense on the concentrated palate that has a pithy, mouthwatering edge and rounded texture. Medium sweet and rich, the finish is laden with generous fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Loew 2017 Engelberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Reduction still clouds the nose of this wine, but in a promising, smoky fashion. The palate shows the vivid ripeness of juicy peach, the slightly bitter, almond-edged pithiness of cooked peach skin and the sweetness of peach compote. Eveything is intense and pithiness makes the mouth water. Drink this rich, mellow but exciting wine by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2018 Steingrubler Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of damask rose entwine with juicy, ripe yellow peach to give this wine a warm, subtle aroma. Spiciness is hinted at, then displayed on the creamy, rich palate where gentle sweetness is countered by a peppery orange-zest note. Concentration and texture seem streamlined, propeled forward by zestiness that seems to fill the wine along with its fragrant medium sweetness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2017 Steingrubler Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Intense peach-compote notes fill the nose of this wine with fruity richness. On the palate these ripe notions are countered by a concentrated and pleasantly bitter pithiness that lends structure and accentuates depth and energetic drive. The medium dryness gets a sweeter spin on the intense finish. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2016 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A balmy, floral freshnesssuggesting jasmine settles on the gentle nose of this wine. The palate comes with the same lightness and floral notes wrap themselves around tones of ripe greengage and Mirabelle. Aromas are subdued but profound and the fruit is ripe but fresh. The finish is medium dry and mellow.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2018 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, notions of ripe juicy peach, baked peach and baked Mirabelle skin all rise from the glass. They come together on the rounded palate as a harmonious, medium-sweet fruitiness that is juicy but laced with zesty, slightly bitter pith that gives this real texture. Ripeness, roundness and flavors all ring with intensity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2017 Eichberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The heady richness of Damask rose settles in with the peach perfume of this wine. The palate unites these tones with fruity, rounded generosity, boosting with mellow sweetness. A pleasantly bitter note, aligned to aromatic orange peel, provides a perfect foil for the richness and makes this an exquisitely balanced wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2017 Spiegel Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, the sunny ripeness and rounded generosity of freshly baked Mirabelle tart jump from the glass. Medium sweetness informs everything and even gilds the apple-peel bitterness that provides beautiful texture to this rich, generous wine. The finish has toning notes of lemon zest and apple peel.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Trois Châteaux Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Concentration is evident from the beginning. Nose and palate of this wine are redolent of peach and Mirabelle compote, heady with sweetness, rounded with ripeness and plump with juice. Somewhere in there a wiry, vivid note of lemon zest adds contrast. The medium-sweet finish has a creamy, mellow note and an echo of pleasant bitterness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2018 Frankstein Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The touch of smoky reduction sits well with the rich peach and Mirabelle aromas of this wine. A slight herbal lift also promises freshness. The palate comes in with juiciness enhanced by medium sweetness and a rounded, mouthwatering texture that has gentle pithiness. The finish is medium sweet but harmonious.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2018 Vieilles Vignes Kaefferkopf Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of Damask rose and peach compote unite into an aromatic, rich nose on this wine. Peach becomes more insistent on the palate where it is joined by Mirabelle jelly and pithy citrus. Medium sweetness makes the fruit luscious and intense while the structure stays firm and fresh. The finish reveals a hint of pepper. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Becker 2016 Froehn Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Heady ripeness on this wine's nose shows a certain restraint. It speaks of peach and Mirabelle, and both these fruits duly appear on the concentrated, medium-dry palate. They are pitched against a gently chalky backdrop and have a harmonious smoothness that is more fresh than mellow, striking a subtle and textured balance.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2017 Moenchberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of lemon candy and lemon oil combine into an intense aroma that's lifted, sweet and refreshing at the same time. The palate also plays with these dimensions of zestiness and sweetness, creating a mouthwatering, medium-sweet wine with joyful juiciness. This is moreish despite its sweetness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2018 Brand Crand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Intense peach compote on the nose of this wine is made fragrant by hints of rose petal. Medium sweetness on the palate amplifies the peachiness and brings out the sweetest, most aromatic highlights of that fruit. A welcome vein of pleasantly bitter pithiness helps to define this generosity and abundance. This wine will benefit from bottle age. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2018 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of lime zest informs juicy greengage and ripe Mirabelle notes on this wine's nose while an edge of lemon balm adds interest. Intense freshness and aromatic sweetness are even more pronounced on the viscous, concentrated palate where fruit flavors echo and ricochet long after the last sip.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2018 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The heady sweetness of Mirabelle compote is immediately apparent on this wine's intense nose. That medium sweetness is edged on the palate by the pleasant bitterness of baked plum skin and made juicy by the expressive, bundled fruit. This wine is round, generous and bold.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2015 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Concentrated notes of peach on this wine's nose almost have a lifted, medicinal touch about them. The intensity is even more apparent on the palate where full sweetness is heightened by a pithy, slightly bitter texture that counters much of this richness. This wine is smooth and rich, almost viscous in its roundness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Specht 2018 Mandelberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe peach are framed with the rich scent of russet-pear peel on this wine's generous nose. All is compact and rounded on the equally generous palate. The peach is juicy and bold, its medium sweetness cut by citrus freshness that creates harmonious balance.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2019 Furstentum Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Mirabelle, greengage and yellow peach fill this wine's nose with insistent juiciness. The palate delivers the same juicy, ripe sweet fruit and tempers the medium-sweetness with a mellow, pleasantly bitter texture reminiscent of baked apple. The finish is fresh, sweetish and mouthwatering.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Les Jardins de Aurélien Altenberg de Bergbieten Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2018 Les Jardins de Aurélien Altenberg de Bergbieten Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of sun-warmed hay join the peachy aromatics of this wine alongside a hint of lemon. Peachiness is emphasised on the medium-sweet palate where the ripe midpalate is reminiscent of canned peach, cut with a little lemon. This is rounded, mellow and totally full-fruited.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2018 Steinert Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: The sweet richness of baked peach and mellow pear rises from the glass. On the palate of this wine, the smoothness of these medium flavors is enhanced by creaminess, vanilla and the bittersweet edge of barley sugar. Generosity, intensity and roundness are the hallmarks.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Brand Crand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Foris makes a distinctive version of this grape, more akin to those from Italy than Alsace. The varietal perfume is there lightly, a touch of rose petals and talcum powder on the nose. Lychee and lemon, citrus rind and grapefruit play across the palate. This would be optimal with Indian fare.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2019 Estate Grown Dry Gewürztraminer (Rogue Valley)

Description: Hints of gunpowder and flint mix with a subtle but sonorous tone of Damask rose on the nose of this wine. The palate brings a much brighter, lemony note of sunny peach ripeness, suggesting the juiciness of peach compote. The purity of flavor is highlighted by lemony accents that frame this generous, nectar-like wine. Drink 2025–2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Clos Windsbuhl Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The nose on this wine conveys both dried and fresh lemon peel, some smoky reduction and wet chalk. On the palate, cool concentration homes in on a ripe but tingling notion of lemon zest. Earthiness anchors this all along with lemon notes that offer vivid freshness. Stony, chalky lemony purity seems to radiate and real energy propels this powerful wine forward. The finish is bone dry and long. Drink 2025–2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Roche Calcaire Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The nose on this wine conveys both dried and fresh lemon peel, some smoky reduction and wet chalk. On the palate, cool concentration homes in on a ripe but tingling notion of lemon zest. Earthiness anchors this all along with lemon notes that offer vivid freshness. Stony, chalky lemony purity seems to radiate and real energy propels this powerful wine forward. The finish is bone dry and long. Drink 2025–2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Roche Calcaire Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Damask rose and crushed elder leaf make for a subtle yet aromatic topnote on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with gentle, medium sweetness that accentuates peachy juiciness at the core and rounds things out with smooth, candied-lemon flavor. Freshness balances this harmonious wine with an endless, off-dry finish. Drink 2025–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2018 Cuvée Laurence Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of mandarin and rose petal are alluring on the nose, hovering above a peach compote core that also defines the the juicy palate. The purity of the peach note is sublime and uplifting, pervaded by freshness. Gentle sweetness makes this wine medium dry and boosts the fruit notes to perfection. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Trimbach 2013 Cuvée des Seigneurs de Ribeaupierre Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A flinty touch of reduction clings to faint rose-petal notions on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with distinct medium sweetness that, together with the lemon freshness, creates a juicy, peachy core. Lemony brightness pulls the entire wine into focus on the medium-sweet finish. All you need now is a superior stinky cheese.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 Kritt Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A full range of peach fills the nose on this rich wine, suggesting fresh fruit flesh as well as canned and candied versions. A hint of rose perfume plays above that. The palate comes with the roundness and sweetness of canned-peach syrup. Lemon freshness counters this and highlights the purity of all those peachy notions.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bott Frères 2015 Vendanges Tardives Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ethereal citrus lift constitutes this wine's nose, conveying not only lemon oil but the fresher, more vivid herbal note of lemon balm. The medium-sweet palate also rings with citric freshness and wraps up juicy, ripe peachiness in its lively aroma. Concentration, warmth and texture become apparent on the rich finish, but the sense of freshness lasts.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2015 Frankstein Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Damask rose, orange peel and pith and juicy peach make for an attractive combination on the nose of this wine. The palate has gentle sweetness that is countered by pleasant, phenolic bitterness that lends shape to this off-dry, spicy, mellow wine. Yes it is generous, but all that zesty pithiness makes the wine intriguing. The off-dry finish is textured.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Roche Roulée Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, rounded notes of peach compote have a slight overtone of rose petals and a spicier hint of grapefruit peel. Each fruit comes to the fore on the generous palate that drips with richness and the slightest trace of sweetness. This is powerful and rounded but countered by a fine, slightly bitter citrus pithiness and spicy zest. Drink 2025–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2018 Terroir S Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Musky notes of honey enrich a sweet notion of peach compote on the nose of this wine. Honey also pervades the sweet, concentrated palate with its aromatic intensity that seems to bring out a supercharged peachiness. All is countered and made pristine by lemon freshness. This intense, sweet wine has an endless finish. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2015 Vendanges Tardives Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of Damask rose and peach compote on the nose of this wine are drenched in hints of blossom honey. Rounded, medium sweetness on the palate intensifies the peachiness, giving a smooth, rich mouthfeel. An attractive edge of grapefruit zest counters this richness with welcome bitterness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp and yet floral aromas of honeysuckle, elderflower and plumeria meet with scratched citrus peel on the dynamic nose of this bottling. It's extremely lively on the palate, offering grapefruit-peel, Asian pear and wet cement flavors, staying brisk and mineral-driven deep into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stolo 2019 Gewurztraminer (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Rich and rounded notes of peach jam show on this wine's open nose and almost have a honeyed edge. The palate offers the same rounded richness and a medium sweetness that boosts those peach and honey notes, set against a textured backdrop of honeycomb and chalk. It's an intense wine of great concentration.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Gaensbroennel Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru
Name: Willm 2016 Clos Gaensbroennel Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This gorgeously sweet wine is well balanced enough to serve before or during a meal as well as with dessert. It offers wonderful rose-petal and grapefruit flavors, a rich texture and a touch of brisk acidity to counter the sweetness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2019 Late Harvest Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Description: The luscious headiness of peach compote is vivid on this wine's nose. Equally vibrant notes of fresh peach and lemon on the palate present a concentrated picture of ripe, intense fruit. All is boosted by medium sweetness and zesty freshness. A slightly phenolic texture provides a fitting backdrop for all this generosity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2018 Zinnkoepfle Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Both flinty reduction and rose notes play on the nose. The palate comes in with concentration and a pithy, phenolic texture that lends structure and backbone to this rich, rounded, almost oily but dry wine. Pleasant citrus-pith bitterness sits well with the bold, warm but dry generosity. It's best to let this come into its own. Drink 2025–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Trimbach 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The nose of this wine is expressive with rose petal and blossom honey. Rounded with residual sweetness, the palate carries those heady rose notes along with mandarin juiciness. That sweet citrus freshness creates balance on this medium-sweet, balanced wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2018 Eguisheim Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Clear blossom honey and Mirabelle compote are the chief aromas on this wine's vivid nose. Both the notions get more intense as they are boosted by the palate's luscious sweetness, which tips the fruit into the candied spectrum. Yet flavors remain pristine and get some backing from chalk and beeswax.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2017 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: This wine's subtle nose suggests apricot compote, with a hint of lemon. Similar restrained flavors characterize the palate, even though its rounded, medium sweetness helps those juicy stone-fruit notes shine. The finish adds concentrated zestiness and just a little alcoholic heat, finishing with fruity purity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2017 Altenberg-Bergbieten Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe lemon freshness frames ripe peach notes on this wine's open nose. The palate has ease and flow, boosted by gentle sweetness and guided by a phenolic edge of pleasant, pithy bitterness. There is concentration and richness but also balance. The finish is long and mouthwatering.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff & Irion 2018 Sporen Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Clear blossom honey and Mirabelle compote are the chief aromas on this wine's vivid nose. Both the notions get more intense as they are boosted by the palate's luscious sweetness, which tips the fruit into the candied spectrum. Yet flavors remain pristine and get some backing from chalk and beeswax.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2017 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: This wine's subtle nose suggests apricot compote, with a hint of lemon. Similar restrained flavors characterize the palate, even though its rounded, medium sweetness helps those juicy stone-fruit notes shine. The finish adds concentrated zestiness and just a little alcoholic heat, finishing with fruity purity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2017 Altenberg-Bergbieten Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of Damask rose are heady on the nose of this wine. Underlying peach and tangerine come out with full force on the just-off-dry palate. They are accompanied by fresh lemon that adds welcome liveliness to this scented, balanced wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2018 Les Éléments Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Hints of earth and lemon cling to Mirabelle notes on the nose of this wine that suggests both fresh fruit and jam. The concentrated, off-dry palate has a vein of freshness that lends verve. A phenolic edge of pithiness also lends direction to this balanced wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar 2019 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
Winery: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar

Description: Rich notes of baked pear on this wine's nose come with touches of vanilla and lemon. The mellow, rounded palate mirrors these flavors and presents them with concentrated richness. This wine is intense and medium-sweet, with emphasis on fruit and expression.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2017 Frankstein Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe peach are vivid and inviting on this wine's fresh nose, accented by hints of iron oxide and lemon. The palate adds rounded, honeyed richness to a concentrated, warm body that is guided by a bitter, phenolic edge. Lovely peach aromas resurface on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ruhlmann 2018 Frankstein Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notions of pear and peach compote create a mellow aroma. The palate of this wine falls right into step and presents a rich, medium-sweet mellowness of baked, creamy fruit on a flowing, balanced body. Pure fruit flavors are long, boosted by sweetness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2018 Praelatenberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle flashes of peach burst above the blossom-honey nose of this wine. Uniting peach and honey in a rounded fashion, the palate gives just a tiny edge of honeycomb bitterness to counter that juicy, mellow flow. The delicacy of the aromas stays throughout and make for a supersmooth finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Saint-Rémy 2016 Ehrhart Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Something creamy on the rose-oil-scented nose of this wine carries peach and Mirabelle. The palate reveals a gentle, bright lemon note that manages to highlight the Mirabelle and peach subtlety of the just-off-dry palate. A wonderful rendition of this variety, the wine has a lasting, refined finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Leon Beyer 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Intense Damask rose perfume is toned down by pithy tangerine peel on the nose of this wine. Gentle sweetness on the nose enhances peachy juiciness at the core, countered by slightly bitter but pleasant notes of apple pip. Rounded, rich and off dry, the wine will benefit from bottle age. Drink 2025–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2018 Roche Granitique Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A subtle veil of Damask rose encloses peachiness on the nose of this wine. Although the palate reveals power and warmth, it cloaks it in subtle rose notes. The finish is just about dry. It's lovely and subtle.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2017 Classic Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A subtle hint of Damask rose has a bit of creaminess on the nose of this wine. The palate shows luscious but textured sweetness, rich with concentrated notes of peach compote. A lovely bitter-almond edge accents the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2018 Fronenberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle honeysuckle accompanies fresh lemon ripeness on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with ease and rich fruit, especially juicy peach, but also precision and brightness. Lemon brightness returns on the off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2019 Collines de Granite Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: On the nose of this wine, a subdued tone of rose has a top note of geranium leaf. Aromatic mandarin peel shows on the palate. Gentle sweetness rounds out the peachy fruit, providing textured balance. The finish is off dry and zesty.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Sipp Mack 2016 Vieilles Vignes Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of ripe, yellow pear are distinct on the nose of this wine. They become even more expressive on the rounded palate where lovely phenolic bitterness lends direction and drive alongside bright freshness. The finish is long and off dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2018 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of white summer blossom dance around peach to create a charming nose in this wine. This floral delicacy moves aside on the palate to give full rein to the concentrated, medium-sweet force of candied peach and blossom honey. Pithy bitterness rather than freshness counters and frames the generosity with its textural force.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar 2017 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
Winery: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar

Description: Honeysuckle notes highlight the mandarin and peach nose on this wine. The palate is concentrated with medium-sweet peachiness, pithy concentration and a lovely edge of citrus-peel bitterness. Citrus notions provide lovely balance to the richness and lead to a medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Blanck 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A bitter hint of licorice intrigues on the nose of this wine, surrounded by honey and peach. The palate gives full rein to the peach fruit, adding rounded, gentle sweetness to boost the ripe flavors. Zestiness lends balance and freshness to the medium-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2017 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle and rose form the floral aroma of this wine, dancing above peachy ripeness. On the palate these notions give way to a bold display of peach with a bitter pith edge, channeling medium sweetness on an almost viscous body. This wine is concentrated and full on.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Zisser Monopole Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru
Name: Andre Lorentz 2016 Clos Zisser Monopole Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Hints of rose and orange peel can be made out on the restrained nose of this wine. Gentle sweetness on the palate highlights yellow-plum juiciness at the core, balanced by subtle freshness and a slightly pithy texture. The finish is off dry to medium dry and echoes long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Sick-Dreyer 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of peach skin and rose petal make for a perfumed nose on this wine. The palate comes in with gentle, rounded sweetness that transforms the fresh peach fruit on the nose into compote richness. Citrus pithiness sets a balancing accent on the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Jean Sipp 2017 Vieilles Vignes Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle, peach and rose petal make for a perfumed nose on this wine. The palate carries these notions on a creamy, rounded body where they are joined by welcome freshness and flavor-enhancing, gentle sweetness. On the finish the wine is fresh, intense and medium dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2018 Les Princes Abbé Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The subtle nose on this wine reveals nothing but gentle yeastiness. With more air, glimpses of rose petal peek through. The palate of this soft, pliable wine offers the slightly honeyed sweetness of peach and yellow plum. It finishes with a pithy, zesty edge of medium-sweet orange.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wunsch & Mann 2017 Cuvée Saint Rémy Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Concentrated peach, almost with an ethereal headiness, makes for an intense nose on this wine. The palate frames the peachy, medium-sweet richness with a hit of bitter pith and overtones of honeycomb that counter the richness. This wine is generous, concentrated and bold.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2018 Mambourg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle and peach on the nose of this wine are joined by a vivid streak of lychee. The palate tones the florals down and focuses on luscious peach flesh instead. Medium sweetness intensifies the fruitiness while mandarin zestiness counters the richness. A pleasant bitter note intensifies the finish. Lovely now, the wine is sure to evolve. Drink by 2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: René Muré 2018 Orchidées Sauvages Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of Damask rose are tender but distinct on the nose of this wine, enriched by lovely peachiness. The palate is framed by a phenolic richness that recalls beeswax, supporting the gentle freshness that highlights more rose aromas. It finishes off dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2018 Kritt Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of peach compote are rich and rounded on the nose of this wine. Mandarin juiciness and a gentle sweetness on the palate boosts both peach and citrus. The lasting finish is aromatic, balanced and medium-sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Jean Sipp 2018 Cuvée Particulière Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Jasmine and narcissus cast a perfumed spell on the intense nose of this wine. Focused on peach compote, the palate presents sweetness shot through with freshness. This wine is sweet but also balanced, with a long, perfumed echo.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2018 Lieu-dit Harth Tradition Cuvée Caroline Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of baked pear with a hint of peach fill this wine's nose with mellow richness. The palate boosts these fruit notes with its medium sweetness, while a frame of bitter phenolics counterpoints the baked-fruit richness.The finish is bold and warm.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2017 Brand Crand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle and rose vie for attention on the nose of this wine. They also hover above the medium-sweet palate where peachiness offers a notion of candied ginger. Spicy and rich, the wine has a pleasantly bitter, lasting finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: François Baur 2016 Herrenweg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A gentle note of jasmine hovers over ripe pear fruit on the nose of this wine. The palate offers gentle sweetness that envelopes a core of juicy peach and pear, radiating richness. Apple-like freshness tones this down and leads to a medium-dry, balanced finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Scharsch 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle rose-petal richness and warmth plays on the nose of this wine. The palate is rounded with juicy peach, boosted by gentle sweetness that is countered by orange freshness. Zestiness and pith lend texture to the midpalate and the medium-sweet, balanced finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine François Schmitt 2018 Bollenberg Cuvée Marie-France Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of earthiness, peach and rhubarb are subtle on the nose of this wine. Soft roundness on the palate shimmers with those fresh rhubarb notes, presenting a zesty counterpoint to the subtle sweetness of the fruit. The finish is bright, fresh and medium-dry, with real texture and expression.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gérard Neumeyer 2016 Taureau Stierkopf Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: An earthy note dominates the nose on this wine before fruity, candied notions of peach kick in on the palate. The body is rounded and luscious with juicy peach and yellow plum, while the sweet finish echoes long with richness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Meyer-Fonné 2018 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeyed apple and rose notes signal richness on the nose of this wine. The palate is fleshy, bold and rich, but instead of the expected sweetness, it brims with dry freshness. This wine needs a little more bottle age to knit together, but the finish is both exquisitely rich and dry. Drink 2021–2025.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Louis & Fabienne Mann 2018 Super Dry Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Funky, yeasty reduction still dominates the nose on this wine. The palate, however, already reveals rounded richness, balanced by zesty, pithy texture that adds pleasant bitterness to the peachy fruit. The finish is balanced and medium dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wunsch & Mann 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Candied peach notes on the nose of this wine have a hint of honeysuckle. The palate then presents that peach in luscious, ripe juiciness. This full-fruited wine is rich and rounded, framed by gentle freshness. The finish is medium sweet and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Rose notes surround ripe notions of apricot and peach compote on the nose of this wine. The palate homes in on peachy richness, oozing with juicy, syrupy fruit. Freshness saves this from becoming too rich and the medium-sweet finish is balanced.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine du Manoir 2018 Clos du Letzenberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The restrained nose on this wine leads onto a gently sweet palate, with a generous mouthfeel where hints of barley sugar, peach and caramel meet. All is smooth and rich, coming together on the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2018 Cuvée Mégane Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The subtle nose on this wine shows mere hints of rose but promises juicy peach. The palate delivers the luscious peach on its medium-dry body that has a lovely vein of freshness. There's a mouthwatering, pleasant note of bitterness on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2018 Vieilles Vignes Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The nose on this wine offers fleshy, fruity richness with notes of rose petal. Rounded peach on the palate is tempered by orange freshness and sweetness. An aromatic balance shimmers with ripe, sweet citrus all the way to a medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Ansen 2017 Westhoffen Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Buttery notions surround baked peach on the nose of this wine, suggesting peach crumble. The palate has textured sweetness reminiscent of Red Delicious apple and more baked-peach notes. The finish is juicy, rounded and medium sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2018 Glintzberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The nose on this wine offers fleshy, fruity richness with notes of rose petal. Rounded peach on the palate is tempered by orange freshness and sweetness. An aromatic balance shimmers with ripe, sweet citrus all the way to a medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Ansen 2017 Westhoffen Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of flinty reduction plays around honeyed sweetness on the nose of this wine. The palate continues this honeyed sweetness, with a slight musky edge and floral overtones. Peach compote juiciness fills the body that finishes medium sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2018 Kugelberg de Rorschwihr Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Richness is apparent from the first whiff of this wine, dominated by lush rose oil and peach compote notes. The palate adds lemon freshness and a pithy edge to frame the concentrated fruit. On the finish the wine is off dry, juicy and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Cleebourg 2017 Grande Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Rose, honeysuckle and peach make a fragrant trinity on the nose of this wine. The palate presents these perfumed, fruity notions in a medium-sweet body, balanced with an almost zesty texture and freshness. This wine is rich but also sprightly.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2018 Gewurz Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Hints of peach have honeyed concentration on the nose of this wine. The palate intensifies the richness with peach-compote sweetness and gentle mandarin freshness. On the finish, it is honeyed and medium sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2018 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A suggestion of freshly cut Golden Delicious opens the nose on this wine. Juicy ripeness also shows on the palate, where a rich, round mouthfeel is scented like rose oil. Freshness returns on the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Hunawihr 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Hints of peach have honeyed concentration on the nose of this wine. The palate intensifies the richness with peach-compote sweetness and gentle mandarin freshness. On the finish, it is honeyed and medium sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2018 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Rose, honeysuckle and peach make a fragrant trinity on the nose of this wine. The palate presents these perfumed, fruity notions in a medium-sweet body, balanced with an almost zesty texture and freshness. This wine is rich but also sprightly.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2018 Gewurz Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honey, baked apricot and cream unite into a rich, promising nose on this wine. The palate brings out the full roundness of blossom honey highlighted by lemon freshness. Rounded and generous, the finish is medium sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2018 Clos des Anges de Rorschwihr Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeyed lychee and peach notes on the nose of this wine come with overtones of jasmine. The palate encapsulates candied mandarin and peach in its medium sweetness. Rich and smooth, the finish is totally tinged with Damask rose.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2018 Cuvée Emile Willm Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, notes of ripe melon have overtones of dandelion blossom. The concentrated palate brims with juicy freshness and verve. Ripe Mirabelle fruit is edged with lemony pith, coming to a refreshing, off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2019 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subdued pear freshness has hints of rose on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with pithy, phenolic structure that balances the gentle residual sweetness. Flavors of peach and Mirabelle plum abound, joined by zesty orange and rose oil on the off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2019 Les Natures Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, a subtle nose unites rosy florals with ripe, juicy peach. These notions also play on the rounded and juicy palate where fruity ripeness is boosted by medium sweetness. The finish brims with freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2019 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A whiff of passion fruit lends a tropical twist to the nose on this wine. The palate presents a juicy combination of peach, yellow plum and rose petal, with a soft sweetness and zesty, medium-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2019 Grande Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of melted butter on the nose of this wine gently envelope the honeysuckle and peach aromas. Butteriness persists on the concentrated palate where it seems enhanced by mandarin freshness. The medium-sweet finish is balanced and bright.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zinck 2016 Terroir Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A hint of flinty reduction accompanies peach and rose notes on the nose of this wine. The palate continues these notions on a juicy, mellow but fresh body that has gentle sweetness. It is elegant and restrained on the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ruhlmann 2018 Vieilles Vignes Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Appetizing notes of rose petal, peach and orange-peel on the nose of this wine promise perfumed richness. The palate presents this peach and rose with medium sweetness and orange freshness. It's fresh and medium dry on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2018 The Furst Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, rose-petal notes blend in with richer hints of maple syrup and lemon barley. These notions continue on the sweet, slightly musky body. The mouthfeel is rounded and rich, and the finish medium sweet and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frédéric Mallo 2018 Cuvée Saint-Jacques Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A subtle nose on this wine just gives glimpses of rose and honeysuckle. The palate presents peach-compote notes and imbues them with warmth, generosity and a dollop of sweetness. A touch of honey shows on the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2018 Grand C Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Earthiness and peachiness appear in equal measure on the nose of this wine. The palate sweeps in with rich, sweet notions of barley sugar and lemon brightness. A phenolic edge offers a slight counterpoint to the lush richness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
Winery: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar

Description: The merest hint of passion fruit plays on the nose of this wine. Equally subdued aromatically, the palate offers medium sweetness with juicy, peachy generosity. The finish shows lots of ease and balance.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: André Kientzler 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honey and citrus pith promise concentration on the nose of this wine. The palate follows this up with intense notions of compote and Mirabelle skin, with a pithy texture that is backed by citrus freshness. This wine is punchy, rich and medium sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2018 Vieilles Vignes Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Passion fruit freshness fills the nose on this wine alongside honeysuckle notes. The palate comes in with rounded but balanced sweetness that emphasizes peachy fruit at the core, along with a pleasant, pithy texture. It is is medium dry and aromatic on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Anne & Marc Wassler 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of reduction and buttery richness accompany mellow peach fruit on the nose of this wine. On the palate the peachiness shows floral edges and a sumptuous and slightly earthy texture. This wine is rounded, smooth and rich, with a medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Rich honeyed notes of baked apple and rose abound on the nose of this wine. The sweet palate brings more baked fruit, adding the rich aroma of apricot and peach. Sweet and rounded, the finish is as lush and honeyed as the nose.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bott Frères 2017 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle peachiness on the nose of this wine speaks of ripeness and generosity. The palate presents rounded, peachy sweetness, edged and balanced by orange-peel freshness that also harmonizes on the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: W. Gisselbrecht 2018 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Hints of summer blossom and rose play around notions of ripe Mirabelle on the nose of this wine. The palate has the same softly scented fruit, rounded and beautifully balanced. This wine is easy, off dry, light and harmonious.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bestheim 2018 Anne de K. Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of rose rise from the glass. The palate of this wine sweeps in with luscious sweetness and more of that rose perfume, bedded on candied-peach richness. This wine is round, sweet and rich, but has a welcome freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2018 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Intense notes of Damask rose are heady on the perfumed nose of this wine. The palate continues in this intense vein and clothes juicy peach in the same rosy scent. Concentrated perfume shows on this wine from start to medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of rose rise from the glass. The palate of this wine sweeps in with luscious sweetness and more of that rose perfume, bedded on candied-peach richness. This wine is round, sweet and rich, but has a welcome freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2018 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of Damask rose and honey dominate the aromatic nose on this wine. The medium-sweet palate adds juicy mandarin notes and a pleasantly bitter phenolic backbone. This wine is rich, rounded and indulgent.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Peach-compote notes rise from the glass, promising both sweetness and richness. The palate of this wine duly delivers, with rounded sweetness and pithy but pleasant bitterness. It finishes medium sweet and lush.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bestheim 2018 Classic Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, vivid notes of candied mandarin have an edge of honey. The medium-sweet palate then delivers honeysuckle-scented peachiness and juicy mandarin fruit. This is rich and rounded but balanced, with a medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2018 Découverte Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of gingerbread and barley-sugar sweets are intense on the nose of this wine. The palate has luscious richness, with notes of juicy peach compote and vanilla custard. Citrus freshness counters all of this generosity. The finish is medium sweet and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2017 Rittersberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A hint of elderflower surrounds the juicy peach notes of this wine. The palate shows gentle sweetness, emphasizing juicy peach but framing it with a pleasantly bitter note that counterpoints the juiciness of the sweet body.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2018 Brudertahl Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Yellow-plum notes on the nose of this wine have an earthy tinge. On the palate, they attain a juicy, syrupy roundness, with overtones of peach compote. The finish is sweet, luscious and rich.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2018 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Damask rose and mandarin peel are heady on the nose of this wine, joining peach and lychee to promise sweet fruitiness. The medium-dry palate adds a welcome dollop of freshness that keeps everything balanced and bright.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Creamy notions of honeysuckle and mandarin fill the nose on this wine. With an equally creamy midpalate, the body has a concentrated texture that recalls candied mandarin peel. The medium-sweet palate is balanced and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff & Irion 2017 Château de Riquewihr Les Sorcières Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of sweet Golden Delicious apple have floral overtones on the nose of this wine. Continuing in that rich apple fashion, the palate also adds welcome citrus freshness on the rounded and full-fruited body. The finish is medium sweet and rich.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Arthur Metz 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Van Duzer Corridor, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a pleasant, quaffable white wine, slightly off-dry, but it almost completely lacks varietal specificity. Light flavors of clean apple and pear fruit are combined with moderate acidity and a touch of residual sugar. But in a blind tasting it would be hard to identify this as Gewürztraminer.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Château Bianca 2019 Gewürztraminer (Van Duzer Corridor)

Description: Gentle notes of peach on the nose of this wine are edged with slight honeysuckle aromas. The palate adds more juiciness to the proceedings to give an off-dry, rounded and generous wine full of ease.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2019 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle rose and slight licorice play around peachy notes on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with luscious sweetness and a concentrated core. This wine is bold, rich, warm and medium sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notes of peach on the nose of this wine are edged with slight honeysuckle aromas. The palate adds more juiciness to the proceedings to give an off-dry, rounded and generous wine full of ease.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2019 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Flinty overtones of reduction still play on the nose of this wine, but underneath luscious peachiness awaits. Coming in with sweetness, the palate presents juicy peach-compote notes and generous richness. The medium-sweet finish is easy and rich.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Robert Karcher et Fils 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle and yellow Mirabelle plum appear with vivid freshness on the lively nose of this wine, supported by a streak of lemon. Sweeping in on a cloud of juicy and sweet Mirabelles, the palate has floral overtones. The medium-dry finish broadens out with mellowness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2019 Signature Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Slight earthiness infuses subtle honeysuckle notes on the nose of this wine. The palate then presents juicy Mirabelle fruit, edged with a pleasant phenolic bitterness that lends structure and drive. It is off dry and earthy on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Jasmine blossom and crisp apple notes on the nose of this wine create appetizing freshness. The palate adds rounded sweetness that lends juiciness and ripeness to the apple and Mirabelle-plum fruit on the rich but bright palate. The finish is easy and medium sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wolfberger 2019 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, a subdued nose with faint notions of mandarin leads onto a medium-sweet palate. Rounded mandarin and peach notes create rich juiciness while gentle notes of honeysuckle play on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zinck 2018 Portrait Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subdued notes of yellow plum on the nose of this wine have overtones of lily and jasmine. Rounded and rich, the palate has a sonorous sweetness informed by peach, yellow plum and some citrus. The medium-sweet finish once again brings out florality.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Specht 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Always a shining star in the dessert category, this bottling smells of liquefied honeysuckle and jasmine, with ample ambrosial aromas of guava and gooey cherimoya. It hits the palate with candied, honeyed, agave-syrup-dripping glee, packing plumeria and tuberose flavors with ample acidity and structure.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Williams Selyem 2018 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (San Benito County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dry, with zero residual sugar, this vineyard-designate tastes of lychee, pineapple and nutmeg. Textured and creamy, with heightened acidity, it has a touch of honey on the lengthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2017 Saralee's Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Enveloping aromas of melon and papaya meld with spicy elements of crushed pink peppercorn and ginger on the nose. The silken palate shows creamy melon and peach flavors, studded with kicks of fiery spice and orange blossom. The floral tones linger gracefully on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Spring 2018 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange blossom and poached apple make for familiar and beautiful aromas to begin this bottling. The palate is bone dry and zippy with acidity, showing flavors of Key lime peel, wild springtime herbs and fresh white flowers.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2018 Gewürztraminer (Central Coast)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sourced from Sunrise Hill Vineyard on the west side of Cayuga Lake, this rich white offers notes of ripe pineapple, pink grapefruit and juiced ginger on the cohesive nose. The off-dry palate is rounded and ripe in juicy tropical fruit and melon flavors, with gentle kicks of peppery spice and ginger adding depth. It's creamy yet well balanced, honed by integrated acidity and a gentle grip of white tea.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2018 Reserve Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of milky white blossoms and ginger are at the fore, with a solid base of creamy melon. This is rich and silken in feel, offering a luxurious palate of melon and white plum, lifted by accents of peppery spice and flowers. Grapefruit bitters add a bit of astringency to help firm up the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Sheldrake Point 2017 Estate Bottled Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Description: Fresh and primary tangerine, peach and apricot abound in this lip-smacking medium-sweet Gewürztraminer. It's a forward, juicy wine laced by a delicate veil of sweetness and puckering lemon acidity. A spray of blossomy florals edge the finish. Drink now through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2017 Spätlese Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Brisk aromas of yellow apple and pink grapefruit are lively and fresh on the nose. There's a rounded, creamy feel to the melon and apple flavors on the palate, with accents of juiced ginger and crushed pepper arising on the midpalate. It all mellows onto a cohesive finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lakewood 2018 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Description: Lavish rose petal, lychee and peach extend from nose to palate in this classically aromatic Gewürztraminer. Light bodied and delicately sweet, it's balanced by crisp tangerine acidity. Best enjoyed now through 2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fitz-Ritter 2018 Spätlese Erste Lage Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Zesty aromas of pink grapefruit, tangerine and ginger mix with a richer core of ripe peach on the nose. This is rounded and silken on the palate, displaying a wealth of peppery spice and flowers alongside grapefruit pith. It shows admirable power and intensity, perfect for those who enjoy the spicy side of the variety.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wölffer 2019 Cellar Series Gewürztraminer (Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of grapefruit, white flowers and pink peppercorn meld with a slightly grassy hop note on the nose. The palate is rounded in feel, showing a creamy melon flavor that's honed by a lick of bitter spice.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2018 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Heady aromas of rose and orange blossoms ride over a core of dried apricot and ginger. The palate echoes the nose, but in a slightly subdued manner, and picks up on the finish with a zesty orange close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2018 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Description: Candied orange peel, lychee and rose petals perfume this classically aromatic but dry-style Gewürztraminer. It's a refreshing, easy-drinking white with a lingering bitter marmalade finish. Drink now through 2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fitz-Ritter 2018 Dürkheim Ortswein Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Description: Notes of sun-dried grain and earth juxtapose fleshy apricot and peach in this basic Gewürztraminer. It's a bit pulpy in fruit quality but finishes on a pleasantly sweet-tart tangerine note. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Desire 2018 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pungent aromas of grapefruit, hops and plastic are an odd start on the nose. The palate shows more finesse, offering a silky palate that carries gentle flavors of melon, citrus peels and peppery spice. It ends a bit short.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Lake Vineyards 2018 Sunrise Hill Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A mild nose of citrus peels starts off this light-bodied white. It offers zesty orange and creamy melon flavors on the palate, with a delicate accent of white flowers.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Boundary Breaks 2018 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Description: While restrained aromatically, this basic Gewürztraminer suggests sunny tangerine and grapefruit flavors accented by a touch of jasmine blossoms. A hint of sweetness lingers on the midpalate but the finish is refreshingly dry. This is a moderately concentrated, approachable sip to enjoy now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2018 Estate Label Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)

Description: Like the cool-climate region from which it originates, this wine, which spends 10 days on skins, is an orange-pink hue, like a sunset's last gasps. The nose is intensely perfumed: candied ginger, rose water, sun-dried peaches with touches of caramel and honey in the background. The palate is opulent, too, but less candied than the nose implies. Bone-dry and creamy textured yet fresh, there's a slight phenolic bite at the finish. This could be an electric food pairing when poured alongside the right dish, say grilled peaches, on a late summer's day.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Gilbert 2018 Gewürztraminer (Orange)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Bright apple and floral aromas are followed by alluring white-cherry and rose-petal flavors and a lingering richness in this flavorful, full-bodied and dry wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Windchaser 2018 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Lake Erie North Shore, Ontario, Canada
Description: A standout among a broad portfolio of white wines, this dry and intensely floral wine is spot-on for true fans of the grape. It is totally dry and nicely balanced, and it continues the perfumed aromatics right on through a palate of lychee and talcum powder in equal proportion.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: North 42 Degrees 2017 Gewurztraminer (Lake Erie North Shore)

Description: Peach and honeysuckle are subtle on the nose of this wine, harmonizing with Valencia orange notes. The palate is bright and fresh, boosted by gentle sweetness that counters the richness, concentration and inherent warmth alongside a pleasantly bitter phenolic edge. Full of flavor, this is a masterful display of harmony. Drink 2023–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Julien Schaal 2018 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe peach flesh, sun-kissed and mellow, has an overtone of rose petal on the nose of this wine. The rich palate comes in with rounded sweetness that gilds the fruit with mandarin juiciness. Phenolic bitterness rather than freshness counterpoints this abundance. This wine is full-on but balanced and will take some bottle age before revealing its full charm. Drink 2025–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Biecher & Fils 2018 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: There's no mistaking this orange wine's unfined, unfiltered nature with its cloudy appearance. There's also no mistaking the variety. The aromas pop, with notes of white flower, ginger and lychee. The palate drinks dry, with a sleek feel and plentiful floral flavors. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2018 Orange Oak Ridge Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Wilted flower and geranium aromas are followed by lightly smoky flavors that are backed by tart, lemony acidity. The acidity is the driver here, leaving it lifted and fresh.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Phelps Creek 2017 Gorge Crest Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Potent aromas of rose petals and lychee fruit lead to extremely fruity, exuberant peach, honey and grapefruit flavors in this delicious dessert wine. It has impressive depth and concentration, seductive sweetness and a rich texture that encourages a long, lingering finish. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Husch 2016 Late Harvest Estate Bottled Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Produced from vines a half century old, this is fermented dry in stainless steel, and finished with tart, juicy lemon, tangerine and orange fruit. Though citrus flavors dominate, there's also a touch of body powder on the nose and the palate, referencing the classic flavors of the grape.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: David Hill 2018 Estate Gewürztraminer (Willamette Valley)

Description: Using the Riesling scale on its back label, this shows up as dry, and indeed it is. The expected varietal aromas of body powder and citrus are there, and along with highlights of lemon rind there is an appealing minerality. It's an intriguing wine, with the acidity and citrus playing against the floral highlights.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Hyland 2018 Old Vine Single Vineyard Gewürztraminer (McMinnville)
