Description: Varietal in floral earthiness and a sleek, sublime texture, this light crisp white shows bright flavors of white peach and lychee, with minimal oak. It retains its acidity well, delivering lasting freshness that appeals.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Russian River Vineyards 2018 Valley's Hand Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This grape, finished bone-dry, is a true strength at Foris, keeping the varietal accents of powdery perfume in check, and giving space for it to be more versatile with a variety of foods, not just spicy noodle dishes. Citrus rind, grapefruit and lychee components are all in play and in balance, and there is nothing sour about the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2018 Estate Grown Dry Gewürztraminer (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Aromatic and very refreshing, this dry, medium-bodied wine offers fragrant rose-petal aromas, tangy grapefruit flavors and a nicely crisp texture. Aged on the lees, it has a freshness and lively texture that are invigorating.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Clif Family 2018 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Description: Somewhat subdued aromas of flower are followed by pear and ginger notes. The palate is dry, crisp and medium bodied in feel, with tart acidity providing the frame. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery and should shine at the dinner table. Try it with roasted chicken basted in an herb butter with citrus and sage.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cinder 2018 Dry Gewürztraminer

Description: Sweet herb aromas are out front, trailed by notes of whole lime and a whiff of ale. Dry, broad-feeling citrus flavors follow. Spice flavors linger on the warm finish. It brings appeal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Fujishin 2018 Gewurztraminer

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Enticingly aromatic and bright in flavor, this full-bodied wine shows lychee and rose-petal aromas, and coats the palate with ripe grapefruit and Anjou pear flavors. Great concentration and a viscous texture carry it through a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: V. Sattui 2018 Dry Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intensely perfumed accents of orange blossom, white pepper and grapefruit ride over a ripe core of yellow apple and Mandarin orange on the nose. The palate is full and silky in feel yet honed by bright shots of juicy acidity and waxy apple peel. It's a beautifully textured white that is only made more enticing by its lingering floral pink-peppercorn finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This white offers an intense nose of white flowers, apple and lychee alongside bright shots of pink grapefruit. Firmly off-dry on the palate, it shows pristine flavors of grapefruit and tropical fruit all honed by persistent, fresh acidity. Blossomy white flowers and peppery spice linger on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Reserve Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This dry and extremely flavorful wine offers rose petal and prosciutto aromas on the nose, with vivid grapefruit and luscious pear flavors on the palate. A rather full body and a lingering finish add to the experience.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Husch 2018 Dry Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A heady mix of ripe yellow apple, white plum, milky white flowers and lemongrass defines the concentrated nose. The palate is bright and crisp in flavors of juicy apple and white grapefruit, with lifted acidity and a powdered, chalky texture lending grip. A lingering white pepper note marks the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2017 Dry Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A flashy nose of orange zest, yellow apple, lemongrass and cherry blossom starts off this well-priced offering. It's cohesive and silky on the palate yet properly lifted by fresh acidity. Flavors of melon and orchard fruit fill it out, with sparks of white pepper, ginger and potpourri spices lending contrast.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Stony Lonesome 2018 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This blossomy beauty offers melon, tangerine and rose on the cohesive nose. It's rounded and silken in feel, lifted by juicy shots of apple and orange that dissolve into a potpourri finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2017 Estate Bottled Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's an earthy tinge on the nose of this wine alongside spiced apple, ginger, white pepper and delicate flowers. Full and juicy on the palate, flavors of yellow apple peel and lemon are condensed yet lifted by persistent acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Shaw 2017 Gewurztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Gentle yet cohesive tones of melon, white plum and pink peppercorn carry the nose. The medium-bodied palate is lifted by juicy acidity, with vibrant flavors of gooseberry and grapefruit brightening up a core of melon and peppery spice.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Weis 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Gushing aromas of yellow apple and cantaloupe meld with orange zest, ginger and white blossoms on the well-concentrated nose. The palate is succulent yet silky in feel, driven by ripe orchard fruit flavors and juicy acidity. Honed accents of potpourri and white pepper linger on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2018 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Loads of white pepper and ginger ride over rose and orange on the nose of this barrel-fermented Gewürztraminer. The palate is rounded yet well balanced by a rush of acidity, with grapefruit and melon melding with lots of fiery spice on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Damiani 2017 Barrel Fermented Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A characteristic Gewürztraminer nose of melon, rose and ginger carries to the medium-bodied palate. Just a shade off-dry, the palate kicks off with a perfumed floral tone that moves to lifted grapefruit on the midpalate. It ends spicy and warm, with lingering accents of juiced ginger and lemongrass.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Shy aromas of pink grapefruit and rose gently perfume the nose. The palate is a shade off-dry, boasting well-rounded flavors of yellow apple, melon and grapefruit. A brisk white-pepper note marks the close of this easy-drinking Gewürztraminer.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While an uncommon grape to craft into a sparkling wine, this bottling is a great effort. A bright nose of rose, apricot and lychee carries to the balanced palate. The bubbles are delicate and soft, giving way to all the fruit and floral intensity. The flavors remain true and clean straight through to the off-dry finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bellangelo 2017 Sparkling Gewürztraminer (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rich, enveloping aromas of candlewax, fennel pollen, canned lychee and peach mix with warm spice and lemon oil on the nose. There's ample weight to the palate, with a grippy fruit-skin quality that lends support to more rich fruit flavors. A light bitterness marks the close to an otherwise intriguing, textural offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Atwater 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A floral-heavy nose offers lilac and pollen, with grapefruit lingering in the background. It's a shade off-dry on the palate, with delicate flavors of yellow apple and citrus that are lifted by juicy acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hickory Hollow 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Soft tones of white plum and yellow apple meld with ginger and white pepper on the nose of this late-release wine. The palate is rounded in feel yet honed by vibrant acidity. Flavors of melon and white grapefruit meet lots of spice on the fiery finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Atwater 2014 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Made from fruit sourced from Sheldrake Point winery on Cayuga Lake, this offers aromas of overripe cantaloupe, white grapefruit and white blossoms on the nose. The palate is rich in feel with a rounded melon flavor. Accents of white pepper and yeast frame the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Living Roots 2017 Spicebush Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An earthy note of Brie rind mixes with sharp citrus and yellow apple on the nose of this wine. The medium-bodied palate brings a mild intensity of white grapefruit and apple, lifted by balanced acidity and white pepper.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Zugibe 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This comes from 1978 plantings and was made as an orange wine; its aromas offer notes of whole lychee and ginger. Dry, broad, slightly boozy-seeming flavors follow. It's interesting but not entirely successful.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Liberty Lake 2018 Gewürztraminer (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Faint yet sharp aromas of tin can, grapefruit and honeydew carry the nose. The palate is light in profile, with delicate citrus, melon and gooseberry flavors all lifted by juicy acidity. Peppery spice marks the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Boundary Breaks 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's an odd soap-like quality to the nose of wilted flowers and gooseberry in this wine. The palate is light and citric, with tart gooseberry and lemon flavors leading to a clipped finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Heron Hill 2017 Reserve Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from one the state's premier white wine vineyards. Vibrant aromas of ginger, marmalade and candied pineapple are followed by sweet, rich flavors that carry on the long finish. The vineyard's hallmark acidity stands it all up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Andrew Rich 2015 Celilo Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a rich rip- mouthcoating wine that feels sweet, and offers abundant baking spice, peach and pear-nectar aromas and flavors. Full body and a smooth texture give it a big mouthfeel and the delicious leesy-spicy character is unusual for the varietal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Windchaser 2017 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Description: Classic Gewürztraminer aromas of gooseberry, lychee and blossoms, with swirling sweet cinnamon notes, are revealed. Ripe melon, apple and Mandarin orange are juicy on the palate, joined by sweet spice. Neutral oak has added a round mouthfeel brightened by sunny acidity, and lingering on a juicy peach note.                      Fiona Adams
Name: White Hall 2017 Gewurztraminer (Monticello)

Description: Sweet pear, tonic water and gin-like botanicals show on the nose of this bottling. There is a compelling sizzle to the palate, with guava, orange blossom and apple syrup flavors that are leveled by lively acidity and a crushed rock tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fetzer 2018 Shaly Loam Gewurztraminer (Monterey)

Description: A shy, chalky nose reluctantly reveals hints of peach fuzz and clementine. Zippy acidity brightens up a softer mouthfeel with notes of yellow apple, Meyer lemon and white grapefruit. Beach grass and lemongrass enter the finish, but aren't overly herbal, and there's some lime pith.                      Fiona Adams
Name: James River 2018 Gewurztraminer (Virginia)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Classic aromas of rose petal and lychee fruit give this medium-bodied wine a great first impression. On the palate, it's rather light and delicate as more subtle peachy, floral flavors come through. Added benefits are a lively texture and good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fulcrum 2018 Dry Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This dry (or nearly dry) wine is lively and well-balanced, fresh and appetizing. Rose petal and peach aromas lead to citrus and peach flavors that are charming and nicely concentrated.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2018 Estate Bottled Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Description: Honey, crushed mint, pineapple juice and ripe peach on the nose make for a complex combination of flavors. The palate of this wine bundles these in a zesty, concentrated, layered package conveying zest, fruit and smoke. At the core, however, there is power and considerable drive. This wine is lovely now but will evolve for the coming decade if not longer. The finish is off dry to medium sweet and zesty. Drink 2020–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2017 Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The headiness of evolution is immediately apparent in this wine. Hints of chalk and honey are lifted and play around subtle notions of dried orange and lemon peel. The palate is dry, concentrated, slender and incisive. A different kind of Gewurztraminer, this is made for the table, with exquisite, dry freshness in its maturity. Honeysuckle notes come to the fore on the lemony finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Leon Beyer 2011 Comtes d'Eguisheim Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Flinty, smoky reduction hovers promisingly on the nose of this wine. Underneath that reductive cloud spicy notes of honeysuckle come to the fore, edged with aromatic orange blossom. The concentrated palate comes with a phenolic backbone that lends structure and enough zesty orange-peel notes to balance the generous sweetness. This wine is both juicy and charming, concentrated and powerful. The finish is fresh, long and zesty.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2017 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: An intriguing note of licorice plays about ripe peach notes on the nose of this wine. The medium-sweet palate shifts the emphasis from peach to lemon, retaining peachy juiciness but pervading it with freshness. The vivid finish is dominated by vibrant and lasting lemon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2017 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Intense notes of candied peach are lifted and pervaded by orange-zest aromas and freshness. Those already powerful notions play out on the rounded, lusciously sweet palate of this wine, where candied peach, pear and Mandarin fill mouth and nose. The mouthfeel is rounded but concentrated freshness makes this wine work. The finish is long and intense.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2017 Brand Vendanges Tardives Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: An earthy touch of crushed dandelion leaf precedes any hint of fruit. On the palate of this wine, the ripe, juicy flesh of tinned peach becomes apparent, framed by orange-zest fruitiness. Everything is concentrated and precise, the zesty notes tingle on the tongue with honeysuckle spice. It's a concentrated wine with subtle but distinct aroma and a well-balanced, medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2016 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Earth and smoke play above aromas of ripe peach, juicy melon and orange zest. The palate of this wine is medium sweet but focuses on the citrus freshness rather than the sweetness, which is tamed and balanced here. The finish is long and precise.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2016 Schlossberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Juicy, ripe and intense peach notes dominate the nose of this wine. The palate continues in the same fashion but imbues the peach with phenolic bitterness that lends a welcome edge. This wine is sweet but precise, delivering a wonderful expression of spicy peach.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2017 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle nuances of peach suggest both white- and yellow-fleshed fruit, while a creamy aspect lends allure. The palate of this wine intensifies this generous fruit with a concentrated, tea-like, pleasant bitterness that counterpoints the medium sweetness. A balanced wine, it has a clean and long finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2016 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Earth, orange pith and pear peel make for a nose that suggests both fruit and texture. The palate of this wine confirms this, presenting a phenolic frame that harnesses the wine's energy and power. There is drive here, with zestiness and a core of juicy, ripe peach. The finish is medium sweet and lasting with pure lemon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Saint-Théobald Rangen de Thann Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2017 Clos Saint-Théobald Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A hint of reduction still lends flintiness on the nose of this wine while ripe peach stirs underneath. The concentrated palate brims with orange zest and a little alcoholic warmth. Full of drive and energy, this is a powerful but well-honed wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2017 Schlossberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The aromas jump out of the glass, with notes of lychee, white flower, orange rind, grapefruit and fresh ginger. The dry palate is richly flavorful and exquisitely balanced and structured. An exceptionally long, spice-filled finish caps it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dowsett Family 2016 Celilo Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Subtlety is the name of the game with this wine. Notes of citrus pith display gentle fruitiness on the nose and then intensify on the palate. Gentle, juicy peachiness on the midpalate has a medium-sweet aspect that balanced by aromatic orange freshness. The finish is zesty and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Loew 2017 Altenberg de Bergbieten Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of honeysuckle play around a citric nose that suggests orange and grapefruit. The palate of this wine comes in with rounded, rich and smooth sweetness, reminiscent of orange jelly and a touch of peach. Precise and balanced, the wine has a long, medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2017 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, yellow peach and Mirabelle plum on the nose of this wine come with lime and grapefruit freshness. The sweetness of the fruit is presented on the palate with rounded juiciness that gives a pure impression of the exquisite fruit on a sweet, luscious but balanced palate.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2017 Gloeckelberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle peach, white summer blossom and faint rose make for an elegant, restrained nose. The palate of this wine adds a more intense note of ripe peach. A phenolic, textural element brings lovely balance to this understated, concentrated and elegant wine. The finish is off dry and floral.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2017 Vielles Vignes Kaefferkopf Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe, juicy yellow pear rise subtly from the glass, accompanied by hints of honeysuckle and suggesting warmth and ripeness. The palate of this wine confirms that impression with some alcoholic heat and gentle flavors of peach, Mirabelle plum and more pear. The finish is subtle and medium dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2017 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Trois Châteaux Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The nose of this wine suggests ripe peach fruit, peach skin and Damask rose. The medium-sweet palate adds flavors of tinned peach and a dollop of ripe orange. Clean and precise, the citrus elements assure balance on the full-fruited finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Schmitt & Carrer 2015 Furstentum Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Hayflowers, dried pear and peach on the nose of this wine lend an almost Christmas-like notion of dried-fruit confections. The palate is concentrated but precise, countering that dried fruit with zesty freshness. Pristine flavors set this medium-sweet wine apart, and the balance is exemplary.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: F. Mallo et Fils 2015 Rosacker Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Lifted, concentrated aromas of preserved peaches and rose petals fill the nose. Equally concentrated, the palate of this wine showcases the evolved mouthfeel of mature Gewurztraminer, a balm-like, almost unctuous liquid brimming with peach and gentle rose flavors. The finish is off dry and seemingly endless.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Blanck 2012 Furstentum Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Concentrated and complex, the nose of this wine suggests ripe peach, tinned peach and Galia melon, all shot through with Mandarin-zest aromas. Intense and medium dry, the palate lets all the aromas take their respective turns. The texture is gentle and smooth and the finish gives a pleasantly bitter counterpoint.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2016 Vieilles Vignes Brand Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from a 1,400-foot elevation, organically certified, dry-farmed vineyard, with all of those being extreme rarities in the state. Very pretty aromas of mineral, orange oil and flower lead to a textured, slightly viscous-feeling palate, packed full of orange zest and spice flavors framed by lively acidity. It's a complete delight.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2017 Oak Ridge Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Gentle notes of fresh peach and rose play on the nose of this wine. Concentrated and medium sweet, the palate offers precise flavors of peach and Mandarin. The wine has well-honed, harmonious balance and a wonderfully fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2017 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A concentrated nose of Damask rose and juicy peach makes for a heady opening on this wine. A hint of grapefruit-peel spice plays on the juicy, medium-sweet palate. Along with citrus freshness, this creates a lovely balance of richness and freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2017 Mambourg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Warm aromas of peach have something spirity about them that is fringed with Damask rose. The palate of this wine offers the full-fruited sweetness of peach, Mandarin and ripe Mirabelle plum. This generosity is countered by fruity freshness and the ample body. The wine is generous yet precise and medium sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2017 Praelatenberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Earthy notes of hay and dandelion pervade peach notes on the nose of this wine. The medium-sweet palate shows ample freshness and a welcome lemon brightness that balances the generosity well.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2016 Marckrain Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Intense aromas of honeysuckle and rose are almost overwhelming on the nose of this wine. The sweet palate has the same aromatic force but offers ripe lemon freshness to balance. This wine is powerful and heady all the way to the clean finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2017 Bruderthal Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Something smoky and phenolic precedes pear and peach notes on the nose of this wine. This smoky, almost earthy notion continues on the rich, almost oily, creamy and mild palate. Rich with ripe peach the body finds a counterpoint in Mandarin freshness. The finish is medium sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2017 Frankstein Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pear on the nose shows flashes of peach and honeysuckle. The palate of this wine intensifies that peachy fruitiness and juiciness. This wine is generous, balanced and concentrated all the way to the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2017 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Creamy, generous aromas of almost overripe peach create a nose full of impact. The body of this wine has a banana-like richness. It's mild, smooth and generous, almost like a dessert in itself. The finish is medium sweet and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Specht 2017 Mandelberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Rose petal and peach on the nose of this wine are bound up with incredible creaminess. The palate carries these flavors with ease on its medium-sweet body that bounces with smooth generosity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Charles Sohler et ses Fils 2017 Frankstein Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Fresh, ripe yellow apple hits the nose before notions of peach candy appear. The palate of this wine has appealing ease, a lightness that helps counter the medium-sweet finish full of fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2018 Furstentum Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Jasmine aromas lead the way to lychee, pear and wet stone in this bright, light and high-toned wine—a whirl of grapefruit and mango on the midpalate. The acidity holds tight throughout, making for a lively experience of balanced fruit and texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 Dutton Ranch Gewürztraminer (Green Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is a thick, though not syrupy, style. Lush flavors combine mint, preserved lemon and guava jelly in a powerful, fruit-driven palate. It carries an impression of sweet honey, though the wine is technically dry. It could accompany something like pound cake (with no frosting).                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2017 Oak Ridge Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Van Duzer Corridor, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Dry and redolent with dusty talcum powder, the flavors touch lightly on the grape's affinity for perfume, focused instead on white peach, melon and almond paste. Layered and complex, it references varietal character without drowning in it.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Château Bianca 2018 Gewürztraminer (Van Duzer Corridor)

Description: Fresh peach, lychee and tangerine are accented by a whiff of herb in this easy-drinking Gewürztraminer. It's semisweet in style with a slightly sugary finish, but fresh acidity and a lingering kiss of sweet spice maintain balance. Enjoy now through 2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2017 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Description: A taste of flint and stone complements the fruitier notions of apple, lemon and melon in this richly made white. From estate fruit, it takes on a creamy lushness on the palate that balances the lively acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gundlach Bundschu 2018 Estate Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Finished dry, this lightly ripened wine displays little of the standard varietal character, and drinks more like a Sauvignon Blanc. It's grassy and puts the emphasis on grapefruit, with plenty of backing acidity. A pleasant, simple wine, it can be subbed in for any number of tart whites.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2017 Gewürztraminer (Willamette Valley)

Description: This off-dry Gewürztraminer doesn't have the intense, spicy aromatics expected of the variety, but its pert yellow pear and lemon flavors make for pleasant quaffing. A touch of dusty minerality lends elegance to the finish. Drink young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Sun Garden 2017 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Description: Exotic spice, yellow peach and apricot perfume this fresh, boldly fruity sip. It's off-dry and slightly sugary on the finish. An accessible, easy-drinking wine to enjoy young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: P.J. Valckenberg 2017 Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)

Description: There is some characteristic peach and lychee flavor in this wine, but it also has a rustic side suggesting slightly pressed apples and dried herbs. It is a wine to drink young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2016 Estate Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this is an extremely aromatic wine featuring apple blossoms, Asian pear, honeydew and ripe white fruits all strong on the nose. The palate zings with acidity, offering rounded flavors of ripe pear and freshly cut apple.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stolo 2018 Gewürztraminer (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: A clean nose of nectarine leads to a nice mix of tropical fruit and flowery flavors including pineapple, mango, orange blossom and a strong dose of rose petal that delivers through the floral finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Carmel 2017 Appellation Gewürztraminer (Judean Hills)

Description: Aromas of honeydew and lavender set the stage for flavors of Granny Smith apple, white peach and violet that wind down to a slightly spicy finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Or Haganuz 2017 Amuka Single Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Galilee)

Description: Honeyed, lifted headiness on the nose of this wine suggests both evolution and richness. The palate adds layers of chalky earth, fresh field mushroom, waxy lemon and pleasantly bitter pith. This shows what Gewurztraminer can be if evolved: layered, rich, concentrated and long. Waxy earthiness dominates the perfectly dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Leon Beyer 2009 Comtes d'Eguisheim Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Zesty blood-orange aromas have both a floral and a smoky touch. The concentrated palate fills the mouth with peachy, ripe roundness while zestiness pervades and brightens. Blood-orange aromatics keep countering and contouring the gentle sweetness of the midpalate and provide bite until the finish. The wine is certain to evolve. Drink until 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2017 Clos Windsbuhl Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of reduction still clings to the nose of this wine. Underneath it and on the palate, juicy peach comes to the fore. Slight sweetness carries the stone-fruit aromas while yeasty notes mingle with bright lemon. The palate is light despite its richness and finishes off dry on a peachy and zesty note.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Loew 2017 Ostenberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle, almost creamy Damask rose on the nose of this wine is accompanied by peach. The palate adds mandarin freshness and the tart sweetness of ripe, juicy citrus. Subtle and balanced, it offers an appetizing interplay of fruity sweetness and zesty verve, with a purity that shines. The finish is refreshing and off dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2017 Kritt Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from 30-year-old vines, this is exceptionally rich and concentrated, managing the trick of reflecting the characteristically floral aspect, yet not letting it dominate. Hints of hibiscus and baby powder are subtle and quickly let the ripe fruit flavors of apple, pear and orange marmalade carry the palate. Complex and long, it's finished dry, but with just enough sweetness to round it off.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brandborg 2015 Gewurztraminer (Elkton Oregon)

Description: Fleshy, ripe pear and juicy peach make for an opulent nose, promising body and fruit. The palate of this wine obliges and presents rounded, generous fruit plus a dash of citrus zest and pith. The finish is off dry and rounded.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2016 Les Eléments Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle orange peel and peach accompany ripe pear notes on the nose of this wine. The palate adds sweetness that accentuates the peachiness and juicy slenderness. This wine is subtle, mouthwatering and beautifully light, balanced by a medium-sweet finish where peach lingers.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe pear and bright lemon have just a touch of honeysuckle on the nose. On the palate of this medium-sweet wine, the flavors intensify. The lemon gets zestier, and with residual sweetness the peach and pear become rounder and richer. Yet despite the sweetness, this wine stays balanced and sprightly with citrus brightness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2017 Fronenberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Flinty, smoky notes of reduction for now cloud the nose, but in an appealing way. Underneath await stirrings of peach and mandarin peel. The palate is equally complex, presenting juicy pear notes, subtle citrus and more of that alluring, earthy smoke. It's an intriguing Gewurztraminer with an off-dry, smooth but fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2017 Lieu-dit Harth Cuvée Caroline Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Light honeysuckle and orange-peel notes play on the nose of this wine. The palate is rounded, almost oily but also compact and off dry, showing a bright balance and harmonious fluidity. The mouthwatering finish reveals ripe pear and subtle florality.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2016 Roche Granitique Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Intense red-apple notes are interspersed with vivid, aromatic touches of orange zest on the nose of this wine. The palate reinforces this apple and citrus juiciness, adding a pithy, phenolic edge that gives texture and is mouthwatering, with energy and warmth at the core. This wine has lovely balance, drive and an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: René Muré 2017 Orchidées Sauvages Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of rose, a hint of lychee and ripe peach create a scented nose of tropicality. The sweet palate brings out the intense fruit of canned peach with overtones of honey. This wine is rounded, smooth and sweet but also balanced. Lovely now, it is certain to evolve. Drink until 2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2017 Clos des Anges Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Lychee juiciness and grapefruit zestiness on the nose of this wine promise tropical pleasure, with an overtone of honey. The medium-sweet palate underlines all that is juicy and fruity. Flavors center on peach, lychee and ripe mandarin, once again with a sweet and rich lick of honey. This wine is smooth, fruity and rounded. The finish is made fresh by bright lemon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2017 Moenschreben de Rohrschwihr Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pear, canned and fresh peach and Amalfi lemon have an edge of Damask rose about them on the nose of this wine. The palate is juicy but light, dry and lemony, carrying peachiness as a memory on the slender body. The finish is dry, lemony and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Leon Beyer 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle notes have lovely subtlety on the nose of this wine. The palate adds peachy sweetness and pithy, lemony zest to counterbalance. There is concentration, warmth, impact but also mouthwatering freshness. The finish is appetizing and off dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A little smoky reduction still plays on the nose but a pithy, phenolic richness can already be discerned in the scent of russet-pear peel. The palate of this wine comes in with medium sweetness that underlines the peachy flavors and spicy nature of this rich, smooth wine. Pith, gingerbread spice and citrus make for a layered, medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2018 Rosenberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Reductive notes cloud the fruity nose of juicy peach. On the concentrated palate of this wine, residual sweetness enhances the peach flavors and ripe lemon juiciness. The wine offers balance, poise and zesty, pithy spice on the way to an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Loew 2017 Westhoffen Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Rose petals and orange zest create an aromatic but sprightly nose. The palate of this wine picks up these elements and adds juicy peachiness. But zesty orange still dominates, with mouthwatering aromatics and freshness. This wine is concentrated and round but the finish is dry, juicy, and appetizing, echoing subtle rose notes throughout.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2017 Roche Roulée Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle, subtle but rounded ripe peach fills the nose of this wine. The palate continues in this peachy, gentle fashion. A slightly bitter phenolic edge adds an attractive almond and pith note that helps the lemon counter the peachy richness. The finish is fresh and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2017 Eguisheim Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe lemon, vivid honeysukle, Damask rose and peach make for a very perfumed nose. The palate of this wine is light, bright and full flavored but preserves a lemony brightness. This is textbook Gewurztraminer, with a refreshing finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle, rose petal, a hint of peach and lots of lemon zestiness create a subtly scented, aromatic nose. The palate of this wine has that pleasantly bitter phenolic edge that, along with the lemon freshness, provides direction on the concentrated palate. Slender and refreshing, the wine finishes dry with pithy spice.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2017 Roche Granitique Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of lychee, peach and ripe citrus carry an edge of honeysuckle on the nose. The off-dry palate boosts the peachy flavors while lemon freshness provides balance and juiciness. It's fruity, bright and very appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2017 Les Natures Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pear notes on the nose of this wine have the slightest touch of honey and gingerbread. The palate continues in this mellow, spicy way, with residual sweetness. A fleshy, juicy flow is countered by pleasantly bitter mandarin pith and lemon freshness. This is a rich, rounded and aromatic wine with a medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff & Irion 2017 Cuvée René Dopff Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Hints of Damask rose emerge on the subtle nose of this wine, alongside fresh, juicy lemon, tart peach and ripe pear. These fruits are also vivid on the slender, refreshing palate. The finish is off dry and very appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Blanck 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Bright, ripe notes of orange zest appear first but soon make way for an almost honeyed note of ripe pear. The palate of this wine dials this back and shows a dry, concentrated, fruity but ultimately streamlined wine with bright citrus notes. The dry finish is long and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2017 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Earthy pear notes on the nose of this wine are pervaded by citrus freshness. The palate plays a similar trick. It offers ample, juicy fruit but a vein of citrus freshness gives a central, bright focus that highlights both the earthy richness and the pure pear fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2015 Estate Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: San Benito, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of plumeria, jasmine, gunpowder and green-tea aromas show on the nose of this balanced sweet wine. The palate is luscious, with honey, pear extract and ambrosial flavors cut by bright acidity and an underlying tannic tension.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Williams Selyem 2017 Late Harvest Vista Verde Vineyard Gewürztraminer (San Benito)

Description: A touch of Damask rose and orange peel play on the nose of this wine. The rounded palate adds juicy peach, medium sweetness and citrus pith. A slight but pleasant edge of bitterness gives structure to the rounded ripeness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2016 Baronne Tonia de Turckheim Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of smooth, ripe, juicy pear fill the nose of this wine. The palate adds a welcome phenolic edge of pithy citrus that gives an almost spicy texture reminiscent of grapefruit zest to this just off-dry wine. The finish is lasting with citrus and peach.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2017 Pfaff Cuvée Bacchus Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: The nose of this wine is subtle, whispering with ripe pear and gentle peach. The palate comes in with concentration and a pithiness that lends structure alongside rich and juicy lemon freshness. The finish is dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2017 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle scents of Damask rose mix with notes of fresh peach on the nose of this wine. The medium-sweet palate adds honeyed notes to the juicy, ripe peach fruit and accentuates the rose perfume. This full-blown, rose-scented but balanced wine delivers real sweetness and a lasting finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2017 Holder Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of honeysuckle plays on the nose of this wine. The palate adds juicy, ripe peach and streamlined citrus to the harmonious equation. Lively and fruity, the wine has a refreshing, off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2016 Classic Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of fleshy, almost overripe peach and pear dominate the nose of this wine. The palate is lighter, juicier and fresher than the nose suggests. The medium-sweet finish is harmonious and unites peach juiciness and ripe orange freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2016 Lieu-dit Rotenberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Apple freshness and a hint of honey play on the nose of this wine. The off-dry palate displays lemon and canned-peach juiciness, adding pithy spice for balance. A dash of ginger and honey spiciness sings along until the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2017 Kugelberg de Rohrschwihr Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Green pear, ripe citrus and juicy peach on the nose of this wine have just a touch of honeysuckle. The off-dry palate majors in the exuberance of this fruit that is made clean and precise by freshness. It's a fruity, bright and welcoming wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2018 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle Damask rose notes mix with peachy ripeness on the nose of this wine. The off-dry palate introduces a zesty and pithy orange-peel character that creates a mouth-filling, aromatic and harmonious wine with good freshness and a long finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2017 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe and juicy pear on the nose gains structure and freshness on the palate of this wine. A pithy texture counterbalances the rich fruit. The finish is off dry but really zesty.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Jean Sipp 2016 Cuvée Particulière Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Faint honeysuckle notes have an edge of lemon on the nose of this wine. The palate majors on youthful freshness, citrus aroma and fruity ease with its slender, off-dry body. This wine is vivacious and summery.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, almost overripe notes of juicy pear abound on the nose of this wine. There also is a sense of baked and dried pear but the palate reins that in with majestic zestiness. This wine is bold, concentrated and hot with alcohol. It's a potent but dry Gewurztraminer of immense impact. The finish is dry and the lovely pear returns on the last notes.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2017 Roche Calcaire Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of ripe pear and orange peel promise both a pithy and a juicy palate. This is fulfilled with juicy, rounded, fresh and aromatic fruit on a compact, concentrated palate. A pithy, phenolic edge helps add structure alongside lemon freshness on the off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A real strength at this estate, this young wine is done in a solid, chunky style not usually associated with this grape. Big fruit flavors combine lychee, lemon and pineapple.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Township 7 2017 Gewürztraminer (Okanagan Valley)

Description: Ripe notes of pear and peach fill the nose on this wine. They are even more expressive on the juicy, medium-sweet palate where residual sweetness boosts the ripe exuberance. Freshness counters this and balances the fruit a bit on this total peach bomb.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2016 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pear and peach notes on the nose of this wine have a vivid lift, almost like ethereal citrus oils. The palate comes in with medium sweetness that boosts peach and pear flavors and plays with that sweet-bitter paradigm of pithy orange peel. It's fruity, medium sweet and expressive.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2017 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notes of Damask rose mingle with ripe pear on the nose of this wine. The medium-sweet palate then boosts touches of creamy pear with a pleasantly bitter phenolic edge that lends structure. A little heat shows on the finish of this mouthfilling, rounded wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine François Schmitt 2017 Bollenberg Cuvée Marie-France Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Apple, citrus and honeysuckle make for an attractive, scented nose on this wine. The palate boosts the lemony freshness, countering it with peachy roundess and a harmonious, medium-sweet finish. The citrus notions last.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2018 Signature Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A subdued nose offers only subtle notes of ripe pear to signal richness. The palate is medium sweet, with juicy Mirabelle plum and ripe mandarin edged with a slight, pleasantly bitter pithiness. The mellow finish has a bitter-sweet tang.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2017 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: This is a concentrated and mouthwatering off-dry wine. Citrus pith and russet-pear peel on the nose promise richness. The palate comes in with reinforced pithiness that lends structure and counterpoint to the residual sweetness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2018 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The scented aromatics of pear peel, honeysuckle, orange zest and Mirabelle on the nose reappear juicily on the rounded, fruity palate of this wine. A pithy, phenolic note counters the exuberance and an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: André Kientzler 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: This wine is harmonious and full of fruit. Fleshy, ripe pear on the nose has a touch of vanilla and baking spice. The medium-sweet palate brings out the pear juiciness and adds peachy roundness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2018 Midelberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Citrus pith and ripe peach play faintly on the nose of this wine. Perfumed rose appears on the palate, boosted by juicy, rounded peach. The off-dry finish is defined by pithiness and rose petal.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2016 Vieilles Vignes Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Orange peel and pith appear softly on the nose of this wine. On the palate, pear and peach fruitiness offer a medium-sweet sensation. Beautifully balanced by gentle lemon freshness, the wine has a long, spicy finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2017 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle peach and subtle orange on the nose of this wine turn into ripe, juicy versions of themselves. They are fully expressed on the slender, off-dry palate where lemon freshness sets a bright accent. The finish is refreshing and balanced.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2017 The Furst Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Hints of rose and honeysuckle appear with peach on the nose of this wine. The palate is light but made rounder by residual sweetness that underlines the ripe peachy notes. Fresh citrus counters it with brightness and makes for an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Juicy pear on the nose of this wine is subtle, with the slightest hint of rose. The palate is fresh with lemon and edgy with citrus pith, both lending structure to the ripe pear and peach flavors. Fruity and exuberant, the wine comes with a just still dry palate.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2017 Pfaff Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: A subdued nose gives little away apart from ripe pear and the slightest hint of rose. The off-dry palate stays bright and fruity with a touch of citrus freshness. The finish is off dry, refreshing and juicy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A faint note of Damask rose plays around the ripe pear aroma on the nose of this wine. The palate brings in a pleasantly bitter edge of citrus pith to counter the rich, rounded fruit. Harmonious, off dry and entirely fruit-driven, the wine has a fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2018 Grande Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Fresh, juicy pear notes abound on the nose of this wine, edged with inflections of Damask rose. On the palate, some deliberate spritz brings out the pithy, spicy nature of Gewurztraminer. The medium sweetness boosts the fruit and all coalesces into a harmonious finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2018 Cuvée Emile Willm Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Slight aromas of pear, lemon and peach are hinted at on the nose of this wine. The medium-sweet palate then boosts the juiciness of the peachy fruit. Lemon freshness provides a counterweight on this slender, fresh and entirely fruit-driven wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Fleshy peach and ripe, juicy pear on the nose get a dose of freshness from deliberate spritz on the palate of this wine. Citrus zest and pith add edge to the off-dry, fresh and fruity palate.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2018 Reserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of honey gives a golden glow to the ripe pear fruit on the nose of this wine. The juicy palate offers rich pear and peach notes on a vivid, light and off-dry body. The finish is full of lemon and pear.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2017 Evidence Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: On the nose of this wine, rich pear notes almost have a touch of honey. Touches of juicy, almost overripe pear also dominate the palate but here they are countered by pleasantly bitter citrus pith. The finish is off dry but mouthwatering.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subtle rose petal and lemon peel on the nose of this wine promise freshness. The palate delivers with gentle dryness and hints of juicy peach. This wine is harmonious, fresh and just off dry on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Preiss-Zimmer 2017 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A shy nose on this wine hints at ripe pear. That fruit is more pronounced on the medum-sweet palate where slightly bitter citrus pith provides structure. This wine is balanced, fresh and mouthwatering. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wolfberger 2018 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of creamy, fleshy, almost overripe peaches fill the nose of this wine. The palate offers medium sweetness and boosts that rich peachiness even more, while a touch of honeysuckle provides aromatics.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Louis & Fabienne Mann 2016 Steinweg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pear melds with maple-syrup spiciness on the nose of this wine. The palate conveys similar richness, with rounded, juicy notes of pear edged with a little Damask rose. There could be more structure to corral all this ripeness. The finish is off dry and full of fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2018 Collines de Granit Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Appealing aromas of rose petal, ginger, pink grapefruit and lychee lead to dry, broad-feeling fruit flavors. A lightly smoky finish caps it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dowsett Family 2017 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Suble peach and rose petal appear shyly on the nose of this wine. The palate adds a little juiciness and lemon freshness but also earthy broadness. This wine could be more focused; however, the finish is off dry and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Specht 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Again sourced from the Gerber Vineyard's 40-year-old vines, this has achieved exceptional ripeness and concentration (15.5% alcohol) yet retains its ethereal perfume and sacrifices no details. It was native yeast fermented in 500-liter acacia puncheons, then aged for nine months on the lees. Baby powder, lilac and chamomile aromas set up this dry, intensely pungent wine with mixed citrus fruit flavors.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ovum 2017 Sinnerman Gewürztraminer (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Dry and crisp, this aromatic wine is packed with delicious, concentrated floral, fruity and spicy flavors that are well-balanced by acidity. It is rather full bodied but stays appetizing and refreshing while still overflowing with rose petal, Anjou pear and lychee notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2017 Estate Bottled Dry Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This ever-so-slightly sweet wine is a very good example of the type, showing vivid rose petal and lychee aromas, mouthfilling grapefruit and honeysuckle flavors and significant richness in body.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2017 Deep-end Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Description: Lychee and yellow flowers are lush on the nose with quince, apple and gooseberry. The ripe sweet palate brings lychee, peach and mango while light bright acidity keeps the sugar in check. A little sugary but charming and pleasant, it dries out on the finish offering lemon juice and peach nectar.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Aurora 2016 Medium Sweet Gewürztraminer (Leelanau Peninsula)

Description: This straightforward and easy-drinking Gewürztraminer showcases a rich blossomy nose of peach and apricot. The boisterous acidity makes this a porch pounder but adds no enthusiasm to the ripe apple, white-peach and lemon-juice flavors. Peach lingers towards the moderately lengthened, forgettable finish, joined by an orange tone.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Shady Lane 2016 Estate Grown Gewurztraminer (Leelanau Peninsula)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tart and phenolic, this has more bite than most versions of the grape, but retains its characteristic hints of floral body powder. The dominant fruit is more rind than flesh, with a slightly bitter grapefruit character.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Henry Estate 2016 Gewürztraminer (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This Gewürtz starts off a little reductive and oniony but it does blow off relatively quickly in glass. In its place wafts a perfume of lychees, flowers, honey, wet stones and spice. Texturally it's rich and creamy but the finish has a bitterness that's a little troubling.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Lawson's Dry Hills 2016 Gewürztraminer (Marlborough)

Description: Classic Gewürztraminer aromas of lychee, apricot, yellow flowers and white pepper are bright on the nose. Light bodied with mellow acidity, the palate offers flavors of lemon peel and wet rock, culminating in a hit of orange before evaporating.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Left Foot Charley 2016 Gewürztraminer (Michigan)

Description: Medium gold in hue, this wine, from the always recognizable Gewürztraminer variety, is a heady combo of rose petals, honey, sun-drenched orchard fruit and a myriad spices. The palate is opulent and waxy-textured. It's spicy and dry but honeyed. There's a much needed lift of acidity but also a bitterness on both the nose and palate that's a little hard to ignore.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Cottesbrook 2017 Gewürztraminer (Canterbury)

Description: Aromas of lilies and apricots show a lot of pollen on the nose with an herbal tinge of coriander. Light in body with lazy acidity on a palate and green with bell pepper, there are flavors of lemon and apple with white pepper, grass clippings and lemon pith. The finish briefly extends the palate before fading away.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Brengman Brothers 2017 Gary's Reserve Crain Hill Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Leelanau Peninsula)

Description: White flowers, river rocks and lemon peels can be teased out on a quiet, neutral nose. Light in body, this has concentration with lemon flavors and faint stony hints resting on lightly steely acidity. Stony qualities extend to the finish as lemon falls away.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Brys 2018 Estate Grown Reserve Gewürztraminer (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A perfumed nose of rose, ginger and melon starts off this powerful single-vineyard Gewürztraminer. The palate is broad in feel, fleshed out by flavors of creamy melon and potpourri, with gentle pithy tones of lemon rind providing astringency. A healthy vein of acidity helps carry it along to a lengthy, spicy finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Spring 2017 Dynamite Vineyards Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of yellow apple and spice meld with a earthy, stony undercurrent on the nose. This is voluptuous and full on the palate, with loads of juicy melon and apple flavors that are peppered with decent helpings of ginger and white pepper.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Sheldrake Point 2016 Estate Bottled Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Description: Though labeled dry, the flavors are off-dry, with a distinctive honeyed character. Scents of clover and rich flavors of candied apricot also contribute to a sense that this is different from most other dry versions of this aromatic grape. Scents of body powder express varietal character, even as the finish leaves a sharp, slightly hot impression. This is the current release.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: August Cellars 2014 Dry Gewürztraminer (Oregon)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of melon and wilted rose carry a medicinal note on the nose. This shows nice roundness on the palate, with bright, juicy flavors of citrus and apple.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Brotherhood 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Blossomy notes of peach and yellow apple carry a candied green-apple undertone on the nose. This is light in profile, with a tart yet juicy palate that's centered around a tangy green-apple flavor.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lakewood 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Notes of yeast, apple and peach show with mild intensity on the nose. The light-bodied palate is pithy and bitter, with lots of melon-rind and lemon-peel flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This aromatic wine has a lively perfume of grapefruit and lychees and a tingly, nicely acidic palate that reveals crisp apple and rose petal. It is medium bodied, refreshing and well balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Clif Family 2017 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Description: Aromas of white peach, passion fruit and hibiscus set the stage for lightly sweet flavors of nectarine, mango, orange blossom and rose petal. This wine is refreshingly cool on the palate and offers a toffee-laced finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Tabor 2016 Mt. Tabor Semi Sweet Gewürztraminer (Galilee)

Description: Heady pollen and lychee aromas waft from the glass, joined by ripe lemon, guava and a hint of white pepper on the nose. The dry palate offers brisk acidity, with flavors of Mandarin orange and rose petal that are sprinkled with touches of pepper and lemon oil. Crisp lime marks the close.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Stone Cottage 2016 Gewürztraminer (West Elks)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a straightforward ice wine that offers simplistic ripe fruit tones and a sugary finish. Barely a hint of the grape's varietal spice remains.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Spindrift Cellars 2014 Ice Gewurztraminer (Willamette Valley)

Description: Medium gold in the glass, this wine has a bouquet of white peach and honeydew melon. It is bright on the tongue, with flavors of nectarine, apricot, lemon and rose petal that lead to lingering citrus finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2017 Yarden Gewürztraminer (Galilee)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: As one of the more expressive dessert wines from the region, this bottling offers aromas of candied honeysuckle, tuberose, plumeria and lime balm on the nose. The unctuous and thick palate is balanced by a slick acidity, allowing honey, flowers and citrus flavors to make for an ambrosial experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Williams Selyem 2016 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewurztraminer (San Benito County)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is one of the few orange wines coming out of the state at present. The aromas enchant, with notes of lychee, rose petal, orange rind and spice. Bone-dry flavors follow, showing a touch of bitterness on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2017 Oak Ridge Vineyard Orange Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine offers a deft mix of rose petal, baby powder and lychee aromas. There's plenty of spice, and, as it's bone dry, it matches well with peppery noodle dishes.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2017 Dry Gewürztraminer (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas leap out of the glass, displaying notes of slightly wilted white flower, ginger, mandarin orange zest and spice. This is a hair off-dry, with plenty to like.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Rocky Pond 2017 Clos CheValle Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made as an orange wine, this offers aromas of floral soap, lychee and spice. The palate is bone dry, with a bitter note on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Ranch at the End of the Road
Name: Liberty Lake 2017 Ranch at the End of the Road Gewürztraminer (Red Mountain)

Description: Aromas of white blossom, quince and mango peel are muffled on the nose. The palate is bright and fresh in ripe citrus and apple flavors that are shot through with lemon-lime acidity. The ripe green-apple finish is delicately balanced between tart and sweet.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Messina Hof 2017 Private Reserve Gewürztraminer (Texas High Plains)

Description: An intense white-peach aroma is joined by soapy tones of lemon, lime leaf, orange oil and gardenia. The palate is delicately sweet yet well balanced by bright acidity. Flavors of ripe white peach, Mandarin, key lime and blossoms ring through the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Designation: Tribute Series Tribute to Memories Naturally Sweet
Name: Messina Hof 2017 Tribute Series Tribute to Memories Naturally Sweet Gewürztraminer (Texas High Plains)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Effusive aromas of freshly peeled orange, floral soap and lychee are followed by just off-dry, slightly oily feeling fruit flavors. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pacific Rim 2017 Ramos Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Snipes Mountain)

Description: Aromas of Satsuma, lychee, gooseberry and lily are luscious and inviting. A burst of sweetness paired with zesty acidity quickly mellows into soft ripe flavors of honeydew melon, white peach and lychee. The palate is creamy in feel, with some tangy acidity on the fringe to balance it out. Ripe yellow peach and sweet Valencia orange linger on the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Llano Estacado 2017 Gewürztraminer (Texas)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This Gewürztraminer strikes a fine balance between the grape's more intense characteristics and subtler, more earth-driven elements. Aromas of ripe yellow apple, green pear rind and a zesty dusting of crushed stone ride over an undercurrent of potpourri spice. With 30% fermented in neutral French oak, the palate is broad in feel yet immensely juicy in a ripe orchard-fruit flavor. Delicate astringency offers a clean close to the tangy powdered-limestone finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hickory Hollow 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An opulent nose of ripe yellow apple and melon melds with highlights of rose, ginger and white pepper spice. The palate is rich and silken in feel yet impeccably balanced by supportive acidity and delicate astringency. Succulent flavors of melon and canned peach meet with flecks of spice and flowers to give an overall broad impression.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Damiani 2016 Barrel Fermented Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A fragrant perfume of rose petals, melon, ginger and white pepper spice comes together in the glass. Succulent in feel, the palate is broad and oily, with supportive acidity and mild astringency maintaining balance. Flavors of juicy yellow apple, melon and spiced potpourri broaden the midpalate and lead to a delicate jasmine note on the lingering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Spring 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A concentrated mix of canned peach, milky white flowers, ginger and rose kicks off this heady yet balanced wine. It's opulent in feel but balanced by a juicy line of grapefruit, keeping the heavier flavors of stone fruit and potpourri lively and lingering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2014 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A delightfully integrated nose of canned peach, yellow apple and potpourri spice translates to the rounded yet succulent palate. It's juicy and persistent in feel, with a healthy vein of acidity that extends the floral finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Silver Thread 2016 STV Estate Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A pleasing mix of ripe melon, potpourri and white pepper carries this wine from start to finish. It's all about its silken, soft texture on the palate, with welcome astringency and juicy acidity keeping the balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Description: The back label posits this as a “dry” style, but there's plenty of fruit sweetness nonetheless. Peach and citrus rind flavors come with a sprinkling of powdered sugar. It's a fairly significant change from the aromatic and detailed 2016 version.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Hyland 2017 Old Vine Gewürztraminer (McMinnville)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe yellow apple, canned lychee and rose water aromas carry to the medium-bodied palate. Balanced by a mild vein of acidity, this is dry in style, with a slightly bitter floral finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Knapp 2017 Dry Gewürztraminer (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Quiet aromas of canned lychee, potpourri and pollen ride under a sheen of corn syrup on the nose. Medium in weight, with a slightly oily feel, this offers light fruit flavors pepped up by disjointed, tart acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A crushed vitamin aroma overpowers tones of wilting flowers and yellow apple on the nose. Flavors of canned peach clash with a disjointed lime zest character, giving this wine a sweet-tart character.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Glenora 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Description: Both the heady honeysuckle and Amalfi lemon notes on the nose seem to benefit from still being tinged with flinty reduction. The palate is intense and comes in with concentrated lemon zestiness that tingles across the taste buds. A smoky stoniness provides a solid and bold backdrop for hints of peach and more florals. This seems to have elixir-like power and prowess. Its central vein of smoky lemon zest makes you go back for more. This needs bottle age but promises to be sensational. Drink 2025–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Rangen de Thann Clos Saint Urbain Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Rangen de Thann Clos Saint Urbain Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of earth meets something perfumed and heady on the nose that is reminiscent of citrus blossom and crushed citrus foliage. That same earthy floral perfume flutters around the ripe orange and peach notes of the medium-sweet palate. This is nuanced and despite the sweetness, has a core of freshness and lemony verve. A very expressive, beautiful wine with a medium sweet finish, this is lovely now but will last the distance. Drink now through 2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The aromatic nose suggests bottled peach and rose petal. The sweet palate picks up both notions but boosts the rose perfume but also adds a vital, deep and zesty vein of lemon freshness which frames this with some rigour. This is very concentrated, intense, very bold and pervasive, almost like a genie in a bottle. It is lovely now but will benefit from bottle age. Drink 2025–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Rangen Clos Saint-Théobald Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of earth and smoke clings pleasantly to the ripe Williams pear notes on the nose before a touch of Damask rose sets an accent. The rose perfume becomes stronger on the intense palate where it is joined by a wonderfully bitter phenolic streak that sets off the medium sweetness. This is intense, highly aromatic and rather heady. The finish is medium sweet but tempered with zestiness. Lovely now, it's sure to evolve. Drink now through 2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Wonderfully aromatic overtones of rose hip tisane and spicy verbena hover on the nose among a  more obvious ripe peach note. The palate takes this ripe peach and edges it with wonderfully stringent lemon zestiness. That spicy edge is intensified by a lovely phenolic undertow. This is a nuanced, layered and intriguing picture of an aromatic, off-dry wine with a seemingly endless finish. Lovely now but certain to evolve. Drink now through 2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2017 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A citrus zest headiness on the nose precedes a very concentrated palate where zesty lemon blitzes against the medium sweetness. That citrus zest delineates the juicy pear and peach notes that swirl headily, showing their purity and fullness. This is concentrated, intense, off dry but supremely balanced. Lovely now but it will be even better with age. Drink now through 2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2016 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A subtle note of reduction still clings to the tender peach notes on the nose. The palate comes in with medium sweetness and paints an alluring picture of peach—of its fleshy, juicy and sweet ripeness, but also of the wonderfully textured bitterness of peach peel. On the finish a bright, lovely streak of ripe lemon zest sets a fresh friendly accent and leaves this with an off-dry moreish finish. Lovely now but it is certain to evolve. Drink now–2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2016 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A very subtle nose suggests crushed citrus foliage while a hint of zesty lemon goes straight to the head. The palate then comes in with gentle ripe and fresh peach, a wonderfully bitter but pleasant edge of walnut and a gentle sweetness that colors the concentrated midpalate in off-dry pleasure. All the zesty lemon ensures lasting freshness on the off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Furstentum Clos des Capucins Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2016 Furstentum Clos des Capucins Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe red-cheeked Mirabelle plums and peach fringed with rose petals on the nose promise juicy full-fruited expression. The palate keeps that promise with a flowing, almost creamy and evolving picture of peach, peach skin and wonderful lemon freshness. At six years of age, this wine has only just began its trajectory of development and, while lovely now, will continue maturing. The off-dry finish is long, balanced and zesty.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2012 Grossi Laüe Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Opulent notes of ripe peach and pear jump from the glass. On the palate they are beautifully tempered by the zesty freshness of ripe juicy citrus. Think mandarin and clementine peel and flesh. This is off dry but very well balanced, striking joy with its exuberant, expressive fruit notes. A touch of peach peel and stone bitterness sets a lovely pleasant counterpoint to the richness and colors the off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Eichberg Trois Châteaux Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Expressive notes of very ripe Williams pear are met with the floral overtones of rose and honeysuckle. The medium-sweet palate then adds the juicy richness of Mirabelle plums and juicy sweet mandarins to the mix. This is expressive, very full-fruited but also zesty and long.
