Lovely now but certain to evolve. Drink until 2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2015 Kessler Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The combination of ripest peach and Damask rose on the nose makes for immediate headiness. This continues unabashed on the rounded medium-sweet palate where the residual sweetness makes the peachiness wash over all the senses. This is full-on, rounded, juicy and totally peachy with a sweet finish. With already a number of years in bottle, this is just about hitting its stride. Drink through 2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2012 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Orange marmalade and apricot compote are the two chief and highly aromatic notions on the nose. They also appear on the palate with a wonderfully zesty sweetness. There is lovely tension here, alongside a slight but lovely phenolic grip. This already is five-years-old but only just beginning to develop. Lovely now but sure to continue evolving with its medium-sweet and lasting finish. Drink now through 2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Kirchberg de Barr Clos Gaensebroennel Grand Cru
Name: Willm 2013 Kirchberg de Barr Clos Gaensebroennel Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe peach have an edge of Damask rose to them on the nose. The palate comes in with an almost viscous roundness, carrying both sweetness and pleasant phenolic bitterness that sets off some of the richness. This is medium sweet and full-on, brimming with the ripest aromatic fruit. Great now but certain to develop. Drink through 2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2016 Eichberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of Turkish delight flashes across the nose before ripe bottled peach takes over. On the palate, the peach reigns supreme with its juicy, generous and aromatic sweetness. The finish is off dry, a little warm but also tempered with a streaky tinge of tangy lemon freshness that makes you want to sip more.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Meyer-Fonné 2016 Furstentum Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A heady lemon marmalade streak on the nose has edges of honeysuckle blossom. The palate sweeps these aromatic notions up in its medium-sweet wake of ripe juicy peach. An edge of lemon and pleasant peach-skin bitterness sets a lovely counterpoint. It is on the finish that the lemon streak triumphs with a final flourish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Preiss-Zimmer 2015 Brand Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notes of peach float from the glass. The palate follows that with a soft, pliable, gentle peachiness, couched in medium sweetness and countered by some lemon freshness. The finish is surprisingly sprightly and also tinged by that lovely lemon zestiness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2015 Brand Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle peachiness on the nose is joined by equally gentle notes of rose petal. The palate boosts the ripe and juicy peach notes with medium sweetness which lends intensity and viscosity to the body. This is tempered with a little zesty lemon and tapers to a medium-sweet but fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Biecher & Fils 2017 Goldert Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Earthy notes of ripe peach on the nose suggest a very full-fruited ripe wine. The palate delivers generously with its medium-sweet notions of bottled peach and ripe pear compote. This is rounded, juicy and generous. The medium-sweet finish is tempered with some citrus freshness and very lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2016 Kaefferkopf Vieilles Vignes Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A honeysuckle overtone mix with hints of ripe peach and zesty lemon on the nose. The off-dry palate strikes a balance between the poles of juicy, aromatic ripeness and lemon zestiness. This is a real mouthful of ripe peach, mandarin and lemon flavors, always perfumed with that honeysuckle streak. Drink now–2025.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2015 Spiegel Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Very ripe notions of yellow Mirabelle plum almost have a citrus edge of marmalade to them on the nose. The medium-sweet palate boosts these fruit notions to the max, tempering them with that orange zest sweetness. This is full-on, concentrated and has quite a bit of warmth on its sweet and intense finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Zinnkoepfle Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Initial Damask rose notes on the nose are filled out with ripe peach scents, with just a little air. The palate then majors on lemon-tempered, fresh and bottled peach fruit. This is medium sweet and totally juicy but comes with a welcome lemon fillip on the long intense finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2016 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The ripe peach notes apparent on the nose are tempered by zesty lemon. The palate picks up this theme where juicy fleshy peach vies with sprightly bright lemon for attention. The result is resounding bright joyful fruitiness on a long, off-dry and fresh finish. Lovely.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Specht 2015 Mandelberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Heady but also very pure notes of ripest Mirabelle leap from the glass. On the palate, their fruit expression becomes even more intense, boosted by the sweetness that swishes across the tongue. A counterpoint of lemon freshness sets an accent of freshness but does not impede the ripeness, expression or flow of the fruit. This is intense, sweet and full-on. The finish is lasting and sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2015 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A notion of rather earthy ripeness suggests peach and juicy yellow pear. With air, the notes of stone fruit, Mirabelle plum and peach become ever stronger and become fully fledged on the sweet palate. The pure ripe fruit expression of very ripe Mirabelle plums is almost spooky in its accuracy. The finish is a little warm but hits home with the full force of its ripe aromatic fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2016 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A nose of pure, juicy and very ripe peach makes for a very inviting opening. The palate follows with an even fuller, even riper picture of that peach, supported by sweetness. This is juicy, flowing, expressive aromatic in its peachiness and tempered both by lemon-zest notes and a phenolic backdrop to finish with just a slight sweetness. Lovely.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Pfersigberg Trois Châteaux Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A lovely note of mandarin peel hovers on the nose alongside hints of honeysuckle. The palate follows with a fully sweet sweep of ripe peach and pear, edged with lemon freshness. It is the tension between lemony tartness and full sweet flowing fruit that creates tension here. Lovely now, sure to develop. Drink now through 2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Martin Schaetzel 2015 Schlossberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Faint hints of Damask rose mingle with more intense notes of orange zest and ripe juicy mandarin on the nose. These juicy rounded flavors continue on the medium-sweet palate, offsetting the residual sugar with the zesty but ripe and aromatic notion of orange and mandarin peel. The palate is rounded and soft, the finish a little warm.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2016 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe peach and rose petal potpourri combine to create a heady aroma. The palate brings even more headiness with a full flow of ripe sweet peach notes. A pleasant edge of bitter peach pit lends some counterweight to this intense wine with its medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2015 Marckrain Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Red apple and ripe peach notes appear on the nose, alongside a touch of honeysuckle. The palate offer more of the same, coming to a fresh off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: André Kientzler 2017 Osterberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Aromatic notions of lemon zest and honeysuckle beckon on the nose. The palate follows this with a wave of sweet ripe juiciness suggesting Mirabelle plums and bottled peach. A careful counterpoint of lemon zestiness creates a delicate balance all the way to the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2016 Bruderthal Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notes of very ripe peach reach the nose. The medium-sweet palate amplifies the juicy peach notes even more, adding some lemon zestiness but also warmth and viscosity. This is full flavored and bold, with a medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Specht 2016 Mandelberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A smoky smudge precedes fabulously ripe fruit notes of juicy pear and yellow Mirabelle plum on the nose. The medium-sweet palate, punctuated with some zesty lemon, gives full rein to the juicy, ripe and sweet Mirabelle notes. There is a lack of definition on the finish but the full fruit makes up for that.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2016 Mambourg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A heady cloud of peach and lemon fills the nose. On the palate, it is the peach notion that becomes fully fledged, boosted by the rich sweetness of this full-fruited, expressive wine. A touch of lemon freshness counters the richness but this is unashamedly sweet and rounded.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2017 Furstentum Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Aromas like white cherries and pistachios, and flavors that are floral and deeply fruity give a lot of depth and substance to this medium- to full-bodied wine. The texture is rich and soothing and leads to a good lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2016 Deep End Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Description: Peach and pear on the nose have an earthy tinge. The palate also presents peach, again with the same earthy tinge but also with a bright lively streak of lemon that tempers the medium sweetness. The finish is warm and generous.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2016 Kaefferkopf Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Humboldt County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy waxy aromas meet crisp and bracing but subdued grapefruit and lemon-zest flavors in this taut, unoaked and medium-bodied wine. It has a slightly austere appeal and good acidity that will liven up food pairings from fish and chips to roast pork.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Briceland 2017 Ishi Pishi Ranch Gewurztraminer (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Crisp and lean, this is an unusually light-bodied and straightforward wine for the grape variety. It has mild green-apple and pine needle aromas and flavors and a tangy texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lula 2017 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange blossom, lime pith, candied citrus and a touch of flint show on the focused nose of this wine. It's quite racy and grippy on the sip, where orange zest and julienned Pink Lady apple flavors dominate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2017 Gewürztraminer (Central Coast)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: It's not indicated on the label, but this is vinified completely dry, making it totally food-friendly. Floral on the nose, the palate is bright with flavors of lemon pith and rind. It's a finely finessed effort, with exceptional length.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2016 Gewurztraminer (Willamette Valley)

Description: This stainless steel-fermented wine is dry, fresh and delightful. Flavors of apricot and white peach tease the palate and are joined by grapefruit, wet stone and lime zest. The vibrant acidity lingers alongside tones of ginger and oyster shell on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2017 Dutton Ranch Green Valley Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Green Valley)

Description: Light in color, this perennially lovely white is fragrant and varietal, lush in white peach, lychee and vanilla. Ginger and lemongrass give an intensity on the crisp, complex finish. It starts and ends dry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gundlach Bundschu 2017 Estate Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Creamy and lush in peach and swirls of vanilla, this is a textured and expansive example of the variety, floral and indeed dry, made in a full-bodied, more explosive style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Baldacci 2016 Frederich Dry Gewürztraminer (Carneros)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Listed by the producer as dry (no residual sugar) and from its estate, this white is fragrant in jasmine and rose petal, the full-bodied style unctuous and ripe. Lemon peel and peach play prominent roles.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mill Creek 2017 Gewürztraminer (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pear rinds, sweetgrass, white flowers and tangerine zest show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is pretty mellow, with hints of orange blossom oil and apple flesh leading into a chalky finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Seagrape 2017 Los Alamos Vineyard Gewurztraminer (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Medium amber in color, this wine offers a bouquet of peach and orange blossom. It feels almost syrupy on the palate, with measured peach, honey, almond blossom and vanilla flavors.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Carmel 2016 Sha'al Vineyard Late Harvest Gewurztraminer (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aromas jump, suggesting candied ginger and oranges, lychees and flowers, making the variety unmistakeable. It drinks off dry, without the acid to stand it up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Snowbirds 2015 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With its lemon pith and white pepper scents and white peach, apricot, flint and ground pepper flavors, this wine feels a bit disjointed. It never quite comes together on the palate before tapering off into a nectarine-flavored finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Or Haganuz 2016 Amuka Gewürztraminer (Galilee)

Description: This is a thick, oily and highly aromatic Gewürztraminer with bath oil, flower extract and Central Park hot dog scents. Its fat, fleshy palate deals lime, lychee, fennel, lemon peel and soap flavors.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Enate 2017 Gewürztraminer (Somontano)

Description: An intense note of fir honey dominates the nose. The concentration and accuracy of that flavor, with its customary sweet bitterness, are astonishing. Underneath this, notions of ripe orange and candied citrus show on a very fluid, almost oily palate. Vivid lemon freshness stands against it and creates a sharp, delicious focus. This wine delivers an arresting juxtaposition of luscious richness and uncompromisingly sharp detail. Drink 2020–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Clos Windsbuhl Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Smoke and flint still hover on the nose, with an underlying perfume of candied orange peel. On the palate this candied-citrus theme continues, with an interplay of luscious, viscous sweetness and countering citrus freshness. This is intense but fresh, rich but vivid, concentrated but sinuous, and strikes an ideal balance. A pure note of peach takes over on the finish. Drink now–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2014 Vendanges Tardives Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Peach, apricot and intense notions of blood-orange zest make for a perfumed, alluring nose. The palate holds on to these enticing aromatics, wrapping them gently in rounded sweetness balanced with candied-citrus liveliness. It's a rounded, medium-sweet but very balanced wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2015 Eguisheim Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: With its voluptuous figure and lavish lychee and rose petal perfume, this is a textbook Gewürztraminer. It's lusciously bold and complex offering concentrated stone-fruit flavors and subtle notes of potpourri and musk. The finish is edged by delicate tea tannins and a hint of warmth. Enjoy now through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Pfeffingen 2016 Ungstein Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Description: Wet earth, ripe pear, rose petals and tangerine zest on the nose almost attain a kind of marzipan spice on the palate. Residual sugar boosts that bittersweet almond notion on the even-handed, rounded and concentrated body. This is lovely now, but will be sensational in the future. Drink now–2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2016 Cuvée Laurence Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: This wine is powerful and incredibly rich. Honeyed, musky notes of candied and dried citrus dominate the nose with their lifted headiness. That same intensity envelopes the viscous and concentrated palate. Candied mandarin and peach still have a damask-rose perfume. Drink 2025–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Vendanges Tardives Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A dried-orange-peel headiness on the nose reveals some development. This orange-peel notion gains more currency on the concentrated palate where a streak of freshness accommodates the slight lick of residual sweetness with ease and charm. Concentrated, layered and intense, it shows what a little bottle age does to Gewurztraminer. Lovely now, it's sure to develop further. Drink now–2028                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2014 Estate Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Juicy mandarin on the nose has a touch of maple-syrup spice. The palate has gentle sweetness but much of that mandarin freshness, too. There is a lovely interplay of freshness and richness on a body that remains svelte despite its roundness. The finish is off dry, zesty and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Roche Calcaire Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeyed richness is immediately apparent on the nose. The palate continues in the same rich, golden and almost viscous vein. Musky flavors recall dried fruit such as sultana and dried apricot, but a spike of fresh lemon balances this sweet wine that veers far into dessert territory. It's still developing but will drink well until 2025 at least.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bestheim 2014 Anne de K Lieu-Dit Vogelgarten Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: This wine shows touches of passion fruit, bitter fir honey andripe peach. These elements unite on nose and palate of this luscious, sweet wine. Ripe lemon freshness and citrus oil set a balancing counterpoint that defines the purity of the fruit even more. Lovely now, it will develop further. Drink now–2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Fronholz A l'Orient d'Eden Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A flinty touch of reduction adds interest to notions of ripe peach, yellow plum and juicy pear on the nose. The medium sweet palate is rounded and fruit-driven but also has textured, phenolic appeal and some tangerine freshness. This wine shows lovely balance.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Lisser Monopole Grand Cru Kirchberg de Barr
Name: Andre Lorentz 2016 Clos Lisser Monopole Grand Cru Kirchberg de Barr Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Wet earth, jasmine and honeysuckle on the nose carry though onto the palate. Here they are met with apple sweet-sourness that creates balance and turns this into a very appetizing proposition. The body is light but dense with flavor, the off-dry finish is long and moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2016 Midelberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of damask rose and peach on the nose become full-fledged on the rounded but fluid palate that shows pristine fruit. A lick of residual sweetness is framed, directed and boosted by mandarin freshness. Flavors are limpid and joyful in their off-dry balance. This wine is vivid and harmonious.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Roche Granitique Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Subdued notes of sun-ripened pear and russet-pear peel on the nose are pervaded by fresher hints of tangerine peel. The palate is a balanced synthesis of juicy pear and peach alongside Mirabelle plums. These notions are boosted by medium sweetness but balanced by texture and freshness. The finish is dominated by a surprisingly pure note of rose petal.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine du Moulin de Dusenbach 2016 Grand Cru Kaefferkopf Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Floral, tender notes of honeysuckle blossom have an aromatic edge of mandarin peel. These fragrant notions carry onto the palate where they are boosted by residual sweetness that enhances accents of ripe peach and juicy mandarin. There is freshness as a counterpoint as well as a textured midpalate. Mandarin notes dominate the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Signature de Colmar Grand Cru Hengst
Name: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar 2015 Signature de Colmar Grand Cru Hengst Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
Winery: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar

Description: Notes of russet-pear peel, ripe peach and earth are pervaded by citrus zestiness on the nose. The palate frames these in gentle sweetness but the concentrated fruit and zestiness provide a backdrop of firm freshness. This wine has lovely balance, great concentration and an extended, off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: René Muré 2016 Signature Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Very ripe notes of pear and peach dominate the nose, while the palate brims with freshness. The concentrated body has texture from the zestiness but also that background of ripe richness. It finishes completely dry, with a streak of mandarin on the long finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Trimbach 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Damask rose and honeysuckle play on the nose. On the palate they perfume mandarin and peach notes, pervaded by sweet citrus zestiness. This wine manages to be light bodied, textured, off dry and zesty at the same time, and displays exquisite balance all though the long, lively finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2016 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Fleshy peach notes on the nose have the merest whiff of passion fruit and mango, promising ample fruit. The palate obliges with intense juiciness boosted by residual sugar that gives a rich texture. Citrus brightness counterbalances all this peachy richness that lasts on the long, sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2016 Clos des Anges Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle, wet earth and peach pop up amid intense notes of damask rose. The palate is equally perfumed, covered by a veil of rose perfume that makes this wine seem richer than it actually is. Backbone and concentration comes from zesty citrus and a mere lick of residual sugar. All elements come together in an attractive package.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Turckheim Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Lifted notes of golden honey already show great intensity on the nose and come out in full force on the palate. Here they are joined by pleasantly bitter notes of waxy honeycomb and candied peach, countered by some lemon freshness. It's a wine of uncommon richness, intensity and luscious sweetness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2013 Sélection de Grains Nobles Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pears and juicy, ripe Mirabelle plums pervade nose and palate with their pristine fruit and ripeness. Lemon freshness counters all, resulting in a supremely balanced, medium-dry wine that astonishes with its verve and freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Pfister 2016 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Tangerine and honeysuckle combine into an aromatic nose. The off-dry palate also rings with that heady tangerine note and provides zestiness for balance. The fruit continues to echo in this wine with lovely intensity and good length.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zinck 2016 Portrait Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A tropical whiff of passion fruit blows away to leave very pure accents of ripe pear and honeysuckle. These fruit notes are sweet and luscious on the palate, countered by zesty lemon brightness. The purity of fruit persists along the extended, sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2016 Bergheim Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Damask rose is heady on the nose. The palate is luscious with sweetness along with fresh lemon and canned-peach notions, resulting in a sweet but very balanced wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2016 Holder Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Fragrant, citrus-driven and very fresh, this wine is unusually restrained for Gewurztraminer on the nose. The palate, however, brims with tender rose petal and off-dry peach notes, finely calibrated against the vivid lemon freshness. It offers exquisite balance, lightness and just-off-dry refreshment.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2015 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A green touch of asparagus and boxwood blends in with the more customary notes of rose petal and peach. The palate is light and fresh, while peachy notes are enhanced by a lick of residual sugar that is balanced by lemon brightness. This wine strikes a lovely balance and has a refreshing, off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Preiss-Zimmer 2016 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of wet stone informs the ripe Mirabelle plum notes on the nose. The palate picks up the Mirabelle notions with a touch of residual sweetness, but keeps the palate fresh with bright lemon. This wine is exquisitely balanced, fresh and fruity, with a medium-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Russet pear, wet earth and honeyed peach appear on the nose and carry right through to the palate. Here they are met with the pristine freshness of ripe Amalfi lemon to create a full-fruited but concentrated and refreshing aromatic wine with a medium-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2016 Les Princes Abbés Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of very ripe peach are pervaded by damask-rose perfume. The palate is rich and even more rosy, textured and round. Phenolic elements set up a pleasantly bitter counterpoint to the sweetness. The finish is rich, lasting and medium-dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Josmeyer 2015 Les Folastries Vu par Isabelle Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Hints of peach play gently on the subdued nose. On the palate, residual sweetness boosts all the fruit notions of ripe peach, juicy pear and yellow Mirabelle plum. All is balanced by citrus brightness, ending in a sweet, rich finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2017 Collection Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Earthy hints play among luscious notes of peach on a surprisingly light and fresh palate. This medium-sweet wine is juicy and totally fruit-focused with its finish of ripe peach.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Ansen 2015 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of reduction still clings to the nose. Once this has blown off, pear and plum appear. The palate is sweet, almost luscious with Mirabelle plums countered by spicy, zesty lemon freshness. The sweet finish lingers.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine François Schmitt 2016 Cuvée Marie-France Bollenberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Peach and damask rose seem to dissolve into rich cream on the nose. The sweet palate is luscious, both with residual sugar and that creamy texture. This concentrated wine is full-on, intense and almost a little too much. The rose perfume lasts on the long finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Lieu-dit Harth Cuvée Caroline Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe notes of pear and melon have highlights of rose petal and lemon. The palate enhances these friendly, fruity notes with some residual sweetness as well as lemon freshness. It's an easy, approachable, aromatic and fruity wine with a medium-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2016 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle honeysuckle perfume wafts above peach and pear notes. The sweet palate has a counterpoint of lemony brightness that keeps the fruit and richness in balance. This wine presents a bright picture of ripe peach, with a medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Robert Karcher et Fils 2016 Harth Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and floral aromas of lime blossom, white peach flesh and a hint of chalk are reminiscent of lemon-lime soda pop on the nose of this bottling. The sip is energetic, with acid and a tension that extends into the finish, showing lime, honeydew and white-flower flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stolo 2017 Gewurztraminer (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Luscious peach has a heady, lifted element on the nose. On the palate this is met with vivid, juicy lemon freshness to create an exciting and balanced wine. The finish is medium-dry and appealing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wolfberger 2017 Signature Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A subdued nose gives mere hints of ripe russet pear. The palate comes in with far more pear, adding juicy Mirabelle plum along with a dollop of sweetness and lemony brightness. A light-bodied, friendly and easy wine, this has a fruit-driven, medium-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Rose, honeysuckle, peach and lemon unite into an enticing nose. The light, fruit-driven palate is boosted by residual sweetness and balanced by bright lemon notes. Drink this fresh, fruity off-dry wine while aromas are at their peak.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: W. Gisselbrecht 2016 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Fragrant pear and white summer blossom create an aromatic, enticing nose. The palate underscores the fruit with bright lemon and residual sweetness, resulting in a fresh, light and medium-sweet wine with aromatic intensity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2017 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notes of the ripe peel of russet pear have a citrus and honeysuckle tinge. The palate also conveys rich, ripe pear fruit, brightened and lightened by a lively lemon streak. This wine has attractive balance and freshness, with a just off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: André Kientzler 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle and lemon zest entice on the nose. The palate adds gentle sweetness and enlivening zest. This comes together as a full-fruited, medium-sweet and tangy wine with a lovely balance and good length.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Vieilles Vignes Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of smoke clings alluringly to ripe russet-pear notes on the nose. The palate comes in with medium dryness that rounds the pear fruit and fresh lemon that defines it. This medium-dry wine offers good balance and a refreshing finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Les Élements Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle and peach create a heady nose. These are just as exuberant on the rounded palate where residual sweetness boosts them to the max. This wine is full on, but with a counterpoint of pleasantly bitter phenolics. The finish is medium-dry and a little warm, but also lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Very ripe notes of peach and juicy, almost honeyed pear promise sweetness from the start. The palate brims with sweet pear and peach that are countered by freshness that just about balances this exuberant, sweet and juicy wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Koenig 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Floral notes of rose and honeysuckle blend with rich peachy aromas on the nose. Aromatic intensity continues on the palate where it is met by citrus freshness to create an off-dry, aromatic and rounded wine with good length.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2015 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of smoke still hovers above the Mirabelle plum compote notes on the nose. The fruit is intensified on the palate by a generous lick of sweetness, drawn into focus by zesty citrus notes. The finish is medium sweet and balanced.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Tender notes of jasmine and rose rise from the glass. The concentrated palate has both freshness and texture from citrus zestiness. Pear and peach notes are subtle but long on the dry, textured finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2015 Classic Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A gentle hint of ripe oranges plays on the nose. The sweet palate reprises this delicate flavor but adds juicy peach and rose-petal notions. Fluid and sweet the palate is also pleasantly fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine du Manoir 2017 Clos du Letzenberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Aromatic notes of ripe, juicy Mirabelle plums are boosted by honeysuckle florality. On the palate these are made more intense by a lick of residual sweetness that is balanced with lemon freshness. It's a very fruity, easy but pleasant wine with a medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2016 Vieilles Vignes Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Heady honeysuckle notes dominate the nose. On the palate lemon zestiness and residual sweetness dominate. This wine is rather juicy, if easy, and provides lots of medium-dry refreshment.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Both fresh and baked peach appear on the nose, boosted by mellow sweetness on the rounded and utterly fruit-driven palate. Gentle peachy notions linger on this medium-sweet wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A subdued nose shows the merest hint of ripe pear. The palate continues with this juicy pearfruit that has just a touch of honeysuckle aroma. The finish is off dry and clean-cut.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Saint-Rémy 2016 Ehrhart Rosenberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A subdued nose only hints at ripe pear. The palate follows with gentle sweetness that draws a clearer picture of ripe, juicy, sweet russet pear and ample lemon freshness. This wine delivers balance and refreshment, despite the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2016 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Just a dash of sweetness accentuates this wine's soft fruity nature. It's a fresh fruity Gewürztraminer offering juicy grapefruit and white-peach flavors balanced by citrusy acidity. This easy-drinking sip is to be enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Sun Garden 2016 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Description: Peach and pear on the nose have a touch of honey. That honeyed, juicy nature comes into full view on the rounded but fresh palate. It's a joyful, medium-sweet wine with seemingly endless fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2017 Cuvée Emile Willm Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The nose of this wine is subdued and a touch of smoke clings to the slight rose-petal perfume. The palate is gently but freshly fruited with ripe pear and juicy apple. It finishes just off dry, and the body is light and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 The Furst Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Notions of wet earth pervade bright pear and peach notes on the nose. The palate majors on peach, adding ample sweetness and lemony freshness to the fruit. It's an intense, medium-sweet wine that remains refreshing despite the sweetness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of honeysuckle plays about the pear notes of the nose. Ripe, juicy pear gets a fruity boost from residual sweetness, while fresh lemon creates a counterpoint. This easy, aromatic and very fruit-driven wine has a medum-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Gentle hints of ripe peach, juicy pear and sweet apple play on the nose. The sweet palate melds them into a juicy, rounded and peachy body that has lemon brightness to freshen and balance it. The finish is sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bestheim 2016 Anne de K Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A tinge of wet earth shows amid the Mirabelle plum and honeysuckle that plays on the nose. The palate takes up this contrasting theme, the earthiness lending texture to measure up against the ripe fruit. It finishes off dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2016 Grande Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe gooseberry and yellow-plum flavors are balanced by sunny lemon-lime acidity in this off-dry, fresh and fruity Gewürztraminer. It's a plump but light-bodied sip with a slightly candied finish. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Description: Ripe pear notes have a touch of honeysuckle and damask rose. Similar flavors appear with their fruitiness and perfume on the sweet palate. The body is rounded but fresh, and the texture is almost luscious, with a sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ruhlmann 2017 Vieilles Vignes Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: An earthy nose suggests russet-pear peel and damask rose. The off-dry palate is rounded and lacks focus but the flavors are clean and fresh. It finishes dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2015 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: An aromatic tangerine streak informs the nose but gets a little lost on the palate. This wine has the richness and roundness afforded by residual sweetness, and just a touch of phenolic bitterness, but it does not come quite into focus.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2017 Collines de Granit Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Intense notes of peach and melon are drenched in honeysuckle perfume on the nose. The palate intensifies these notions with an ample dollop of residual sugar and enticing, contrasting lemon zestiness. This wine is heady and distinctly sweet. Drink while aromas are at their peak.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2017 Signature Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: An earthy tinge clings to the ripe pear and rose-petal notes of the nose. The palate is rounded, fleshy and sweet with ripe peach and juicy pear but lacks a little focus. However, the fruit is out in full force in the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Léon Manbach 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Lemon oil and Mirabelle plums have a honeyed aspect on the nose, with a whiff of honeysuckle. The sweet palate boosts the yellow plum and pear notes with residual sugar. The finish is rounded and sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2017 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of acacia honey, lemon blossom and Granny Smith apple carry the nose. On the palate, there are flavors of custard and baked apple that lead to an off-dry finish.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Casic 2015 100% Organic 100% Unforgettable Traminac (Croatia)

Description: A touch of earthiness accompanies a peach aroma on the nose. The palate follows with juicy sweetness, boosing peach and a counterpoint of earth and lemon freshness. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Mersiol 2017 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: This dry refreshing wine seems alive with tangy acidity and delicate citrus and floral flavors. It feels light bodied, crisp and appealing—just the thing for a summertime lunch and with simply prepared seafood.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2017 Nuvola Grand Island Vineyards Gewürztraminer (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This restrained wine starts with a light smoky meaty aroma then has very dry, crisp and mineral-like flavors that are ever-so lightly accented by floral peachy notes. It feels light bodied despite sufficient alcohol, and is beautifully balanced and delicate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Windchaser 2016 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This ebullient wine has an aroma like smoked ham and roses, then sweet-seeming generous fruit and flower flavors. It is full bodied, fairly rich in texture and leaves a lingering floral finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: V. Sattui 2016 Dry Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange blossom oil, stargazer lily and grapefruit-granita aromas show on the nose of this dessert wine, which is transcendent in some years but merely delicious this time around. A soft viscosity frames the palate, where flavors of honey and orange-blossom syrup arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Williams Selyem 2016 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (San Benito County)

Description: Emblematic aromas of lychee, rose and ginger abound on the nose, with white grape, aloe and juniper. These tones are intense on the palate yet they carry a slightly soapy sheen. Medium in acidity and body, the fruit flavors extend the long, spicy finish.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Gray Ghost 2017 Gewürztraminer (Virginia)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a fascinating wine at all turns. The color is not darker than water, and the aromas are extremely juicy with orange blossom, poached pear, bubblegum and gardenia—one of the most aromatic bottlings around. The palate is bone dry with a chalky flavor and backbone, yet hints of bubblegum and plumeria give warmth.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Banyan 2017 Gewürztraminer (Monterey County)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Vibrant white flower, lychee and candied ginger aromas are followed by bone-dry fruit flavors in this wine. It shows exquisite length and balance, with a flavorful finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Viola 2016 Traminer Aromatico Oak Ridge Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a dry elegant version of a sometimes boisterous varietal, and has the typical rose-petal and grapefruit aromas, then good, crisp and somewhat restrained fruit on the palate. The wine has great acidity, a touch of astringency that's mouthwatering, and a clean finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Clif Family 2016 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Kept on skins for eight weeks, the aromas of this orange wine explode from the glass, with notes of candied ginger, lychee, rose petal and orange rind. It shows pleasing weight and intensity, with a viscous feel.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Two Vintners 2016 O.G Extended Maceration Olsen Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Yakima Valley)

Description: A solid choice for anyone seeking a medium-sweet wine, this bottling starts with aromas of Key lime pie, orange blossom and lemon-lime soda, leaning toward petrol. Racy acidity slices through the palate, which is sweet in honeysuckle and orange blossom flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fetzer 2016 Shaly Loam Gewürztraminer (Monterey)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are like walking through a field of wildflowers, with off-dry fruit flavors to back it all up. There's not a lot of complexity but it still provides plenty of appeal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2016 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: High acid yet tilting toward off dry with 13 g/l residual sugar, this shows the spicy side of the grape, rather than dousing the drinker in perfume. It plays out broadly peachy across the palate, dotted with hints of powdered sugar, ginger and melon.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Anam Cara 2015 Nicholas Vineyard Dry Gewürztraminer (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Made in a solid, chunky style, this emphasizes fruit over floral characteristics. Flavors of white melon, sweet herb and lychee come with just a hint of talcum powder. It's finished dry and ready to drink while young and fresh.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Phelps Creek 2016 Gorge Crest Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This very sweet, 210g/l dessert wine was produced cryogenically. It's peachy and syrupy, with candied apricots and a touch of maple syrup. There's just enough acidity to cut some of the treacle, but the sweetness has a sugary granularity rather than a smooth, integrated mix of flavors.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Anam Cara 2015 Nicholas Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: This wine's rose petal, orange zest and Mandarin aromas rise headily from the glass. The palate frames this aromatic surfeit with a wonderfully creamy texture and an electric streak of freshness that recalls lemon pith. It comes together in a sophisticated package of pleasure that combines fragrant abundance with precision and dryness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wohlmuth 2016 Alte Reben Gewürztraminer (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Heady aromas of rose and jasmine meld with rich tangerine and red apple notes. Off-dry on the palate, melon and florals meet with plenty of acidic cut from grapefruit zest, leading to a candied lemon and ginger finish. Weight, power and balance make this an excellent offering from winemaker August Diemel.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Spring 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange blossom, tangerine souffle, light honey and gin-like botanical aromas show on the nose. The palate's concentrated sweetness combines orange zest with lemon cream, making for a nicely complex after-dinner sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Williams Selyem 2015 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (San Benito County)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Clean and focused on the nose in tangerine, fresh red apple, and pear, these notes carry to the light-bodied palate, with delicate rose petals showing midway. Balanced acidity, a mild, chalky texture and lingering floral finish give this wine some cachet.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Burnished gold in hue, this is already showing some development on the nose, with ginger, saffron and furniture polish, with lingering rich peach and red apple. Incredibly juicy on the round palate, more stone fruit carries the flavors, with melon showing midway and orange spice on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Sannino 2016 Gewürztraminer (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's no mistaking the variety, with its perfumed aromas of rose petal, lychee and spice. It drinks a hair off dry and is broad in feel, gliding on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pacific Rim 2016 Ramos Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Wilting flowers—green stems and all—meld with soft citrus on the nose. The rounded palate boasts plenty of ripe peach and melon, with loads of more florals dragging along. Mild acidity tries to keep up but ultimately dissipates on a green, geranium finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2015 Estate Grown Gewürztraminer (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the Gerber vineyard's 40-year-old vines, this bone dry and aromatic wine is perfumed and styled with Old World elegance. It avoids the sometimes off-putting, cloying perfume of the grape, proposing instead more tangy fruit and dry extract. It was fermented in neutral wood with native yeasts and left on the lees for nine months.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ovum 2016 Since I Fell For You Gewürztraminer (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's no mistaking the variety in this wine, with its lychee and white flower aromas. The palate is dry and broad in feel, with bitter notes on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: 14 Hands 2016 The Reserve Dry Gewürztraminer (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Spring blossoms and pink grapefruit abound in this feather-light Gewürztraminer. Just a shade off dry, pristine tangerine and peach flavors are juicy and quaffable. It's a zesty, refreshingly spry wine to enjoy now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2016 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Description: Gorgeous orange blossom, peach and pineapple abound in this classically perfumed Gewürztraminer. Semisweet on the palate and delightfully sprightly, it's a straightforward yet elegant apéritif. Drink now through 2020.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fitz-Ritter 2016 Dürkheimer Abtsfronhof Spätlese Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)

Description: Offering delicate whiffs of blossom and nectarine, this is a soft-spoken Gewürztraminer. Off dry in style, it's an easy-drinking white, with juicy grapefruit and peach flavors. The finish is long, extended by a hint of bitter almond skin. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2016 Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aromas are a bit disjointed, its rose petal and spice notes seeming dried out. The palate is quite sweet, without the acidity to back it up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut
Name: Owen Roe 2015 The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut Gewürztraminer (Yakima Valley)

Description: Earthy mineral notes are brightened by whiffs of white blossom and grapefruit in this subtly sweet Gewürztraminer. Soft acidity and feather-light texture add to its delicate feel. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: St. Christopher 2016 Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)

Description: Pops of sweet, juicy yellow cherry, honey and caramel burst on the nose and palate of this robust off-dry Gewürztraminer. It's ripe and clingy on the palate but balanced by sunny tangerine acidity. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Heinz Eifel 2016 Shine Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Highly aromatic on the nose, notes of flowers and soap carry the lead. In the mouth, this is oily in feel yet with a strong vein of acidity. A quick blast of lychee flavor finishes short and bitter.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Río Negro 2016 Cogolludo-Guadalajara Gewürztraminer (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: With zero residual sugar, this winning white comes as advertised: dry and delightful in its floral, fresh and fleshy character, vibrantly supported in acidity. Peach, lime and pear flavors find length and purpose along a medium-bodied texture that's just the right amount of plush.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gundlach Bundschu 2016 Estate Vineyard Dry Gewürztraminer (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This sweet and vibrant wine is a rare find. Wonderful floral, grapefruit and honey aromas lead to incredibly concentrated ripe flavors on a lush texture that's lifted by underlying acidity. It's almost irresistible now, but will be best after 2022.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Husch 2014 Estate Bottled Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a touch of effervescence upon opening this twist-top bottling, which makes the aromas of fresh tangerine peel, pear cider, white rocks and Pink Lady apple skins very accessible. It's extremely racy and zippy on the sip, with tons of citrus blossom and ripe stone-fruit flavors, all cut by a slightly sour mineral-laced acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2016 Dry Gewürztraminer (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from vines planted in 1968. Fragrant aromas of orange peel, flower, spice and sweet herb lead to dry-drinking fruit flavors. The concentration seems a bit lacking but there's still interest to be had.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: History 2014 Mont Elise Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The aromas seem surprisingly subdued for the variety and style, with notes of flower, herb and spice. It drinks sweet but doesn't quite have the acid to back it up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Andrew Rich 2014 Celilo Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: This medium-sweet wine brings aromas of acacia flowers and lemon lime zest to the fore. In the mouth there are flavors of honeycomb, lemon and acacia flower. The finish is delightful and slightly sweet.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Jidvei 2016 Treasure of Transylvania Medium Sweet Gewurztraminer (Tarnave)

Description: A tender notion of slightly bitter, dark fir honey appears first before a touch of smoke and ripe peach come in. The off-dry palate uses its sweetness to underline the rich peachy fruit that also has a touch of golden mirabelle. The big bold palate is concentrated and energetic, pervaded by a streak of zesty lemon freshness that keeps this from becoming too rich. There is undeniable drive here, and a very lasting persistent length of peach and lemon flavors which will develop much more with bottle age. Drink. 2017–2037.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2015 Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A rather lifted nose of peach and blossom creates a heady opening. There also is the merest hint of vanilla. The palate reprises these notes with creamy vanilla, ripe peach and honeysuckle. Warmth is palpable on this rather luscious, incredibly generous and still-evolving wine. The finish is beautifully corralled into zesty sweetness by ripe lemon. This is layered and complex and must be savored slowly. It will continue to develop. Drink 2017–2027.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2011 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Ripe notions of juicy peach and yellow pear rise from the glass. Around the edges they have an aromatic touch of grapefruit zest. That zesty notion remains a constant fixture on the very rich medium-sweet palate, countering the luscious richness of the fruit which shines with honeyed peach, juicy pear and ripe tangerine. It is the zestiness that frames everything on this rich powerful palate. This is lovely now but it has all the fruit and concentration to age well. Drink 2017–2037.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2015 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of quince plays about the rich notes of peach and tangerine on the nose. An aromatic notion of dark fir honey leads onto a medium-sweet palate of ripe peach, zesty tangerine peel, golden mirabelles and lemon. The citrus elements provide a high-toned brightness that works very well with the sweet juiciness and richness of the palate. On the palate it is the wonderfully aromatic zestiness that lasts and lasts.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2014 Kessler Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A lovely, heady lift of lemon, peach and passion fruit dances on the nose. This rich sweet-fruited tropicality is played out fully on the medium-sweet palate where the passion fruit swirls tartly alongside sweet ripe generous peach. It is the passion-fruit aroma and tartness that gives this a real edge. This not only has sweetness but a real tropical thrill. It's a very concentrated, pure-fruited wine with lots of promise. Drink 2017–2027.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2015 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Peach and honeysuckle already have a notion of honeyed sweetness and ripeness on the nose. The palate boosts both fruit and floral notion to the top, where honeysuckle and rose petal notes meeting with peach on the medium-sweet palate. This is full on, joyous, juicy and rich with expressive, exuberant flavor. An underlying concentration almost feeds this with a fiery dynamic force. The finish is medium sweet but comes with a wonderfully redeeming pure lemon streak. This is ready now but will get even better with age. Drink 2017–2037.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2015 Clos Saint-Théobald Rangen Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The yellow-fruited richness of mirabelle compote with a touch of vanilla becomes apparent on the nose. The palate is just as luscious as promised but also carries a welcome, thrilling streak of lemon oil at its core, brightening and framing the medium-sweetness with its zesty lift. A touch of pleasant phenolic bitterness can just about be felt, adding dimension to the palate. This is intriguing and exciting in the way it plays with richness and sweetness while keeping them on a very tight rein. Lovely. Drink 2017–2027.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Pfister 2013 Engelberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A lifted lemon-scented nose of peach gives and impression of ease and lightness. The palate, however, lays on generous sweetness to focus on ripe juicy peach notes. There is a huge concentration of flavor and richness, countered by that lemony freshness. This is a big but gentle wine that leaves your mind ringing with peach and lemon and a touch of honeysuckle spice. The medium-sweet finish is long and balanced. Drink 2017–2017.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Saint-Rémy 2015 Ehrhart Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A wonderfully tender hint of Damask rose swirls into the nose, followed by a smoky, grounding earthiness. The palate plays with that rose flavor and adds a touch of peach and tangy citrus zest. The palate stays on the off-dry site and focuses on zesty spice and a wonderfully textured phenolic edge. It masters a wonderful high-wire act between richness and zesty vigor. The wine is beautiful, full-flavored and exciting with a long just-off-dry finish. Drink 2017–2027.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2015 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A subtle hint of sandalwood and rose plays alongside the juicy pear of the palate. There is a rich floral creaminess on the palate that flashes a touch of vanilla and hints of Damask rose. A pleasantly bitter phenolic edge gives direction to the dynamic energy of fruit that trembles at the core of this wine. Hints of rose, lemon oil and peach linger long after the last sip. This is concentrated, off dry and energetic. Drink 2017–2027.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2015 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: Warming aromatic notes of fresh and dried peach reach the nose. The palate revels in the peachy sweetness, adding a lovely, pleasantly bitter phenolic edge. The flavors are concentrated and have both a welcome tangy zesty edge and some honeyed spice. There is quite a bit of palpable warmth. This is full on and exploding with peachy fruit. The medium-sweet finish is long and warming. Drink 2017–2027.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2015 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A very lifted touch of fir honey hits the nose first before ripe peach with the merest touch of vanilla follow. The palate is incisive and concentrated. Alcoholic heat fires up the mellow, rich and rounded palate that brims with peachy fruit and flavor while zesty lemon oil hints illuminate and brighten the richness. This seems to have only just started on its trajectory. It is ready to drink but it will evolve much further, becoming ever more itself. The finish is just off dry and very long with lemon zest and peach. Drink 2017–2037.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2011 Grossi Laüe Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: An earthy touch of yeast plays promisingly on the nose. The palate then comes in with a concentrated load of ripe peach, bright lemon and rounded rose perfume. An edge of dark fir honey adds even more spicy richness. This brims with flavor, showing rich fruit against fresh lemon. There is lots of excitement here but also balance. This is a rich warming generous wine. Drink 2017–2027.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2015 Steingrubler Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A tender but perfumed hint of honeysuckle appears first on the nose, followed by rich peach hints. These notions persist on the palate where the peach and ripe yellow-plum notes are boosted by residual sweetness and countered by phenolic, slightly zesty but pleasant bitterness. You can feel the warmth on the medium-sweet finish. This is full on and rich, almost unctuous—perfect for blue cheeses.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2015 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A funky smoky notion of yeast clings to the nose on which a pure lemon streak becomes apparent. A generous, luscious and almost creamy sweetness then conquers the palate, boosting all of the fruit flavors, wrapping them in its creamy mellow embrace. The pure lemon streak counters and brightens the richness and around the edges there is grapefruit spice. This is all rather beguiling but not overdone. The finish is moreish, medium sweet and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Clos Gaensbroennel
Name: Willm 2012 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Clos Gaensbroennel Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A rich floral notion of dandelion precedes the rich aroma of ripe peaches on the nose. The palate opens into a kind of vast peach mellowness, edged with a touch of citrus zest and a grounding, earthy element. A gentle sweetness boosts the peachy roundedness but does not dominate. This is gentle on the surface but very concentrated at the core. It is on the off-dry finish that the lemon zest comes though triumphantly. Drink 2017–2027.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2012 Marckrain Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A funky glint of smoke and yeast precedes rich notions of mirabelle and peach compote. The palate enforces this notion of rich sweet compote even more and adds a welcome lemony vein of freshness to it. There is great balance here between juicy ripe sweetish fruit and tangy uplifting freshness. The finish is off dry and generously fruited.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2016 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: There is an earthy touch to the almost overripe peach notes on the nose. The palate adds both sweetness and a subtle welcome hint of phenolic bitterness to the peachy fruit. Bright lemon freshness cuts through the medium-sweet palate to provide a fresh, almost lip-smacking finish. This wine is full of ripe expressive fruit flavors, giving equal billing to lemon and peach.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2015 Mambourg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A full blast of very ripe peach hits the nose. The palate adds a touch of lemony freshness and a sweet rose perfume to this, creating an off-dry, floral and fruity swirl across the palate. There is something gentle about this, something charming and friendly. The lemony freshness keeps everything on the bright vivid side. The finish is lasting and off dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Hunawihr 2016 Rosacker Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A kind of zesty ripeness rises from the glass, uniting ripe tangerine and orange peel with a lovely notion of peach. There also is a lifted touch of honey. The medium-sweet palate gives these flavors full rein. Fleshy ripe fruit is bathed in honeyed while zestiness provides a counterpoint. This one is wonderfully rich, rounded and aromatic with long-lasting flavors.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2015 Gloeckelberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A tender subdued nose gives hints of honeysuckle and ripe mirabelles. The medium-sweet palate lets the stone fruit speak even louder but a pleasantly bitter phenolic edge provides a frame for the juicy sweetness. This is rich and generous and has a lovely tang of tangerine on the warm finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2015 Altenberg-Bergbieten Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A both heady and leafy swirl of passion fruit adds a tropical touch to the nose. The palate brims with sweetness and zesty passion fruit and grapefruit spice. The flavors are intense and the palate is medium sweet, aptly countered by lemon and passion fruit. This strikes a lovely balance and gives tons and tons of fruit and flavor.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2016 Furstentum Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: The golden ripeness of yellow stone fruit is already apparent on the nose. On the palate a pleasantly bitter phenolic edge provides some structure to counter the luscious medium-sweet richness. That sweetness boosts all the fruit notes and lets them linger. It's a rounded, balanced and totally fruit-driven wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2016 Frankstein Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A touch of vanilla can be discerned in the sweet peachy juiciness of this wine which is already apparent on the nose. The palate is fluid, almost plump and rich with these flavors, especially peach and rose, come to the fore. A pleasantly bitter phenolic edge saves this from becoming too rich. Alcoholic warmth is apparent on the rich sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2015 Brand Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A lovely notion of ripe mirabelle and clean citrus makes for an appealing nose. The palate highlights the mirabelle with a honeyed rich sweetness that is juicy and appetizing. A touch of spice seems reminiscent of dark fir honey. The lemon brightens and invigorates this full-fruited richness. The finish is long and medium-sweet.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Mersiol 2016 Frankstein Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: There is an earthy, funky touch on the nose at first but freshly cut peach comes through quickly, edged by the tang of lemon balm. The palate is medium-sweet and the richness makes the peachy ripeness shine. This is full on, lavish but fresh with a long medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2016 Mambourg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Description: A notion of apple peel clings to the aromas of peach and mirabelle that swirl on nose and palate. The medium-sweet body has a lightness and ease about it, but also a very earthy grounding edge. The richness is countered by some lemon freshness and a phenolic element. The finish is warm and intense.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2015 Seppi Landmann Zinnkoepfle Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is concentrated and rich, almost oily. Dense aromas lead into a mouthfilling wine with flavors of ripe banana, Meyer lemon and candied pineapple. It's on the edge of sugary, with a slightly grainy mouthfeel, and finishes a bit off-dry.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brandborg 2014 Gewurztraminer (Elkton Oregon)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Lively, dry and packed with fruit flavors, this medium-bodied wine starts with peach and apricot aromas, adds crisp apple and white peach notes on the palate and is tangy with acidity from the first sip to the last. Made in a stainless steel instead of oak barrels, it has all the freshness one could want.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Phillips Hill 2016 Valley Foothills Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Lake Erie North Shore, Ontario, Canada
Description: Despite its youth, this is already a deep gold color. It's intensely aromatic, with floral scents leading into a dry palate with lychee and talc powder in equal proportion.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: North 42 Degrees 2016 Gewurztraminer (Lake Erie North Shore)

Appellation: Lake Erie North Shore, Ontario, Canada
Description: Produced from late-picked grapes, this 100% varietal concentrates perfumed scents and flavors into a wine that is almost syrupy. The score reflects a slightly bitter flavor that comes up in the finish and lingers stubbornly through the next sip.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: North 42 Degrees 2016 Late Harvest Gewurztraminer (Lake Erie North Shore)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Quite dry and reserved in flavor, this wine is intriguing: subtle rose petal and mineral notes, medium body and a bite of grapefruit zest on the finish that begs for another sip. One of the earliest producers of Gewürztraminer wines in Anderson Valley, it's still one of the best.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lazy Creek 2016 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied full-flavored wine is a great example of the dry-style wines from Anderson Valley. It starts with a rose-like perfume, then floods the palate with Anjou pear and white peach. It feels rich and creamy, but also has good acidity and a tasty lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fulcrum 2016 Dry Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: From vines planted in 1982, this delivers exuberant lychee, spice, rose petal and citrus zest aromas. It's dry and medium-bodied on the palate, with spice-driven flavors and floral notes that persist on the (slightly warm) finish. It drinks well on its own but really sings at the dinner table.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dowsett Family 2015 Celilo Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Packed with apples, peaches and raspberries, this light-bodied wine was aged in large oak casks and is quite fruity without being at all sweet. It has very good balance, is thirst-quenching but not filling, and will pair well with a range of seafood, salads and lighter main dishes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2016 Estate Bottled Dry Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Husch has been making Gewurztraminer for a long time and has it down pat. This is an excellent example of a dry, floral wine that's fun enough for an outdoor summer concert and serious enough for a winter's lunch. It smells and tastes floral, peachy and a little nutty, with medium body and good acidity to balance it.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Husch 2016 Estate Bottled Dry Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pristine grapefruit, lemon and cantaloupe perfume this bold, fruit-forward Gewürztraminer. While off dry in style and densely concentrated in apricot and citrus flavors, it's balanced keenly in acidity and finishes with mineral refreshment.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2014 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delightfully fresh, this off-dry Gewürztraminer wafts of zesty tangerine peels, lychee and blossom. Sweet citrus flavors are concentrated but brisk, tinged by hints of crushed mineral and a whisper of vanilla cream. Drink now through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bellangelo 2014 Gewürztraminer (Seneca Lake)

Description: It's a treat to find an aromatic wine that's this dry, light-bodied and steely in character. The wine has white peach flavors, great acidity and a truly appetizing texture that fits the classic definition of an aperitif: something to whet the appetite.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2016 Nuvola Gewürztraminer (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of white tea and tropical fruit perfume this pretty, delicately concentrated Gewürztraminer. While full bodied and moderate in alcohol, it's brisk, almost ethereal style lends grace and refreshment. Drink now through 2018.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Spicy tangerine peels perfume this intense, full-bodied Gewürztraminer. It's richly textured, almost creamy, in mouthfeel but balanced brightly in acidity. Hints of fennel and pollen pepper a pleasantly phenolic finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Sheldrake Point 2015 Estate Bottled Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Characteristic notes of lychee, grapefruit and jasmine blossoms lend a classic air to this full-bodied Gewürztraminer. It's not deeply concentrated on the palate but dry in style and balanced by brisk acidity. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Heron Hill 2016 Reserve Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This light-tasting wine is a soft and easy sipper. A touch less bold than the last two vintages, it still has plenty of fresh fruits like apple and peach in the flavors, light to medium body and mild acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Clif Family 2015 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Brisk lemon peel and crushed mineral tones lend vibrance to this dry, full-bodied Gewürztraminer. Bright tangerine and lychee on the palate linger with a touch of earth and pollen on the finish. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Damiani 2015 Sunrise Hill Vineyards Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Description: Aromas like apple skin and peach skin lead to flavors with a little more heft and ripeness, like pears, lychees and apricots. It offers a lot of taste complexity and easily keeps the interest going with good acidity, medium body and an almost spicy finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: PRIE Vineyards and Winery 2016 Mokelumne Glen Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Lodi)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Luscious grapefruit and lychee juxtapose earthier notes of saffron and fennel that extend from nose to finish. It's a dry, full-bodied Gewürztraminer with sunny acidity lending freshness to the midpalate. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Stony Lonesome 2016 Estate Reserve Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Juicy, plump and just a shade off dry, this medium-bodied Gewürztraminer offers easy, fruity grapefruit and pear flavors accented by hints of jasmine tea, saffron and fennel. A touch of tea tannins lends structure to the finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Rooster Hill 2016 Estate Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Jasmine, lychee and tea leaf notes perfume this light-footed, slightly off-dry Gewürztraminer. Fresh citrus and stone fruit flavors are crisp and easy going, finishing on a more herbaceous tone. Drink now through 2018.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Glenora 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine brings high-toned aromas of white flower, lychee and spice. The palate is broad and light, with a distracting bitter note on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Bonair 2016 Dry Gewürztraminer (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This outstanding wine should earn the somewhat difficult grape many new fans. It opens up beautifully with ample aeration and is true to variety without giving the impression of cheap perfume, emphasizing spice over powdery scents and showing plenty of ripe fruit, from Asian pear, to pineapple to jicama.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2016 Dry Gewürztraminer (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Produced from vines a half century old, this is fermented completely dry yet retains a distinct floral/talc character. Although Alsatian in style it, exudes a bit of extra fruit flesh, as one would expect of Oregon. It's a lovely wine, with rose petal scents and light peach flavors.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: David Hill 2016 Estate Gewürztraminer (Willamette Valley)

Description: Labeled 'Old Vine' now that the vineyard it's sourced from has passed 40 years of age, this dry, aromatic wine is varietally true without seeming cloying. Green banana, grapefruit and pineapple flavors feature prominently, along with a hint of lemon verbena.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Hyland 2016 Old Vine Gewürztraminer (McMinnville)

Description: Lychee, pear drop, geranium and rosewater entice on the nose. The palate mimics the nose and is joined by concentrated, rich notes of honeysuckle, chamomile and ginger candy. Full and round in body, this finishes long and plush with evolving flavors.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: James River 2015 Gewürztraminer (Virginia)

Description: A scent of fresh-squeezed orange juice is likable, while this feels grabby and rubbery but hollow. The finish is all flavors of apple and pickled green fruits.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Fuego Blanco 2016 Gewürztraminer (Pedernal Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This one-of-a-kind in the state wine was fermented on skins for 12 days, giving it a light-orange color. The aromas leap up from the glass, with notes of spice, lychee, orange peel and mineral. The palate is dry and textured, with a rich but still sleek feel. Put it on the dinner table to see it shine.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2016 Orange Oak Ridge Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))
